Title: Can a user accept answers during a suspension?
Body: If I had posted a question that got an answer, and if I hadn't accepted the answer before I got suspended, would I be able to mark the answer as accepted during the time that I was suspended from the site?

Title: Cannot review from iPhone app?
Body: I think review is better thing to do than answering questions, when I am on mobile. But I cannot find option for review in my iPhone app. Is it not possible to do review tasks from mobile?

Title: What's the point of getting hats at the end of the year?
Body:
As we know, every year before Christmas, we are able to collect some hats. Although it's interesting to get various hats, my question is what's the point? Are they gonna turn to reputations or some badges in new year?

Cause as far as I know, they will just hide after few days and you won't hear about them even next year till you start collecting some new hats which you don't know where will they go!

Is there any sensitive answer?

Title: How is anomalous voting detected?
Body:
Sooner or later, a user may see that his answers are getting a lot of up-votes, then he gets a large negative reputation change labelled "voting corrected". This is because a user has voted on the answers in a short period of time, and then the system detects it and deletes the votes. Obviously, this is to protect the site from scripts, sock puppetry, or from people sorting answers by author, not content.

I have heard that you should avoid "five votes in a row", but how exactly is unusual voting behaviour detected? Is the exact algorithm classified?

Title: Is the Stack Exchange Network blocked in China?
Body:
I'm going to China soon, so I want to know whether the Stack Exchange Network is being blocked in China.

A lot of useful and great websites are blocked in China, such as Facebook, Twitter, Google, and even Wikipedia. So I wonder if SE is also blocked.

I think it isn't, because it doesn't really contain sensitive information (I guess). However, my SE account is linked with my Google account, and Google is blocked in China! So would I not be able to log in to my account in China? If I can't, are there other alternatives?

Title: Add List-ID header to newsletters for easier filtering
Body:
Stack Exchange newsletters currently don't include a List-Id: header, or indeed any easy way to filter them other than Subject: header.

For example, you could use something like List-Id: <history.list-id.stackexchange.com> for the History Stack Exchange newsletter.

PS: The Message-ID on that message was <2.ffa89d65a6400c8e9c1e@NY-WEB01>—it looks like you've accidentally appended just the hostname, instead of a FQDN. That doesn't guarantee global uniqueness.

Title: What's the point of the "From Review" link in LQ canned comments?
Body:
When reviewers in the Low Quality Posts review queue recommend the deletion of a post, they have the option to leave a canned comment, and many reviewers do indeed leave such comments. The system adds a "From Review" link at the end which goes to the review item. Users without the edit privilege (2K on launched sites) are able to see the votes of each reviewer, while those with the privilege can cast their own vote if they have not already done so.

I am concerned that this automatic link may not be desirable behavior, especially for new users. Specifically:

  1. Clicking the link shows their post under the heading Low Quality Posts. It's kind of like a "ha ha, computer thinks you did bad." This probably doesn't make users feel too good, especially if the post was fine and one reviewer made a mistake.
  2. Looking at the list of specific users that recommended deletion feels like a "ho ho, look at all these people that think you did bad." Note that reviewers appear in this list even if they didn't leave the canned comment.
  3. Users without the first review privilege (500 on launched sites) probably won't have seen the review interface before, and aren't expected to have read up on the review process or the LQP workflow.

In general, it just doesn't seem that the link needs to be publicly visible.

The only advantage that I can see of the link is that it lets community members with the edit privilege see that the post landed in LQP and that they might want to review it too. Maybe the link should be made a little indicator like the parenthesized number next to close or edit?

Does the "From Review" automatic link serve a useful purpose?

Title: No chat for mobile-app?
Body:
I love stack exchange and its mobile app however I feel it is missing the ability to use the chat in the mobile app. Everytime I want to chat I have to go to my mobile browser and sign in again and even still the chat is a little buggy.

Why can't you chat in the mobile app? Is it not possible or is there a reason it is not included?

Title: Where to ask "how to dissassemble lk-55 piano"?
Body:
Please recomend a SE site for the following question.

I don't know if I have to be very specific with the details of my actual question here. In short:

I have a casio "electronic keyboard" (musical instrument), model is lk-55. I need to dissasemble it (because it's mine and I want to clean it/ repair it/ see the inside / make use of the parts. The problem is that there is a cover and a back. I must pull apart them in order to access all the mechanism inside. But there are various cables, apparently solded, are they solded ? What to do? Is this dissasembleable?

That's all. Maybe a technology site? I think there isn't.

Title: Feeds not getting updated in ticker in chat room
Body: We have added feeds in ticker in our chat room, as we add feeds after removing, it gets displayed. but after dismiss of ticker, we are not getting back when feeds get updated.

Title: Review bar prevents me from editing posts in low quality queue
Body:
The issue is caused by the review bar having fixed position when you scroll. I'm not sure what purpose does that "feature" serve.

I am using ad-block for now, the panel is useless anyway, but somebody could probably fix it.

Title: Indicate "freshness" of featured Meta posts in the Bulletin
Body:
Community Bulleting and featured-tag together are a decent way to promote important things on Meta to more users. However, I feel¹ like the following frequently happens:

  1. Users sees new featured question, clicks through.
  2. User reads, interacts, and clicks away.
  3. The user ignores the Bulletin entry of this question in the future: "been there".
  4. The user misses new answers (among other things).

I propose that the Bulletin indicate that there is new stuff to see. There are two options: indicate "new stuff since you last visited" or print "updated [date-time]". The latter is more in line with how SE works in other places, so that's probably the way it should be.

Mockup:

  1. Voting and commenting patterns, but I have not collected proof.

Title: Tag statistics: how are they calculated?
Body:
I was having a glance at the statistics for a specific tag:

Considering that today is the 6th of January and "this year" is so far equivalent with "this month" I wondered if the line in the red not-quite-rectangle above is the result of someone trying to find good shorthand expressions for "last 30 days" and "last 365 days" and failing.

Title: Why can't start I a bounty on the app?
Body: I want to start a bounty on my own question from the app, but I do not see any button for that!

Title: Allow moderators to choose their default user view
Body:
Currently, the default user view for normal users is the Profile tab, and for moderators it's the Activity tab.

On sites I moderate, I often find the mod dashboard view for users to be more useful. I'd like to be able to set this so that it's the default view when I go to a user's profile page.

I'm thinking an extra option in the mod menu there:

This could also be rolled out for all users, if it's useful.

Title: Able to vote on question but not answer after "joining a community"
Body:
This is a rather strange bug, it's not terribly crippling, and I can only reproduce it a small number of times for obvious reasons, but here you go:

  • I followed a link to a Q&A in the Hot Network Questions (to crypto.SE, if that matters).
  • I found the Q&A interesting so I wanted to upvote them, but didn't have an account on crypto.SE yet. I clicked "join this community" at the top, confirmed the account creation, and was redirected to the Q&A.
  • I was able to upvote the question, but when I tried to upvote an answer I was told by a little red popup "You must be logged in to upvote an answer" (or something to that effect).
  • When I reloaded the page I was no longer logged in.
  • I logged in again, and was then able to upvote the answer. From then on everything worked as expected.

What happened here?

Title: Is there a way to mute user(s)?
Body: If someone or some group of people are abusing the @user handles and asking trolling questions. Is there some way to mute the person and prevent notification from the specific user's usage of @ handle to notify me?

Title: Should I approve valid backtick only edits?
Body: I think they are too minor, therefore I tend to reject as too minor - they are taking place instead of more important edits in review queue. Am I correct?

Title: Back button and pagination - state not saved
Body: On SO, after paging through X number of pages using the pagination menu, then viewing a question...Hitting the back button returns to the initial page listing of questions but back to page 1 - is this a known bug? By design?

Title: I don't understand most tag wiki edits in review queue
Body:
I skip through most tag wiki edits because I have no clue about the topic. I would need to google it up and verify all the information and that's simply more work than I am about to invest into review queue. Some edits fix a broken link - even this requires me to check both links to see if it's not spam/advertisement.

I don't think tag wiki edits belong in suggested edits queue at all. They require different knowledge, different skills, have different UI.

I want to hear what you think - am I just too lazy? Or does it sound like tag wiki reviews take me longer than they should?

Title: Different hover colors in help page
Body:
Mouse hover "See new questions" button:

Mouse hover "Ask a question" button:

Mouse hover "Visit the Help Center" button:

As you can see, when I hover my mouse over the "See new questions" button or the "Visit the Help Center" button, the text of the button turns blue. When I hover over the "Ask a question" button, the text stays white.

I was wondering if this was by-design or not, since the blue text on a blue background is quite hard to read.

EDIT: I just found out that the text remains white after clicking the button for the first time. If my theory is correct, then new users will see all blue text on hover, which would make it quite confusing for them.

Title: Show titles of sidebar items in tooltips
Body:
If you mouse over just about anything on a Stack Exchange page -- buttons, post links, user cards, even timestamps -- you'll get a helpful tooltip. If, on the main page, you mouse over the title of a question, you get the first few lines of the question in a tooltip. This is great, and a well-established pattern -- mouse-over usually does something on SE.

There's one additional place where it would be really helpful to have such tooltips:

If your browser window isn't wide enough to fully show the sidebar, you have to scroll horizontally in order to read the titles of community events, related questions, and hot network questions. Could we please have the full title strings in tooltips over those items as well?

Title: What site would be best to ask about Verifone customization?
Body: I have a question about Verifone terminal and swiper devices. I want to customize them but don't know how nor know where to ask in Stack Exchange. Help?

Title: "Forgot" password on login form interferes with browser filler
Body:
Safari 9 on OS X introduced a key indicator to allow you to select a password from the Keychain. However, the "Forgot" link inside of the text box makes it unusable. Attempting to click the key always results in the forgot link getting clicked.

It is occasionally useful to be able to use the key to select a password.

Title: How should I draw a moderator's attention to someone who's commited to an Area 51 proposal with an inappropriate name?
Body: I noticed a proposal where there was a committed user whose name was around the lines of "f*** the people who proposed this". This person hasn't commented or anything, so I can't flag one of their posts, but their name is still front and center on the proposal's main page. What can I do to draw moderator attention to this person? There aren't any flag/report buttons on their profile / commitment box.

Title: Is this section layout on Area51 intentional?
Body:
I've viewed Area51.SE on a wide range of different browsers in the recent past, and every time it looked like this:

I don't know about you but to me, that vast expanse of emptiness in the center seems... superfluous, at best.

Is this intentional? Why not make the tabs go horizontal, or be two rows? I can't imagine why it would be desirable.

The screenshot was taken using Chrome 47.0.2526.111 on Linux.

Title: Why are the A51 proposal ads cut short?
Body:
Here. Look at this: Stack Exchange Q&A site proposal: FIRST Robotics http://area51.stackexchange.com/ads/proposal/87670.png

This is the non-altered advertisement for an A51 proposal. Reproducible by clicking on the picture link and clicking Share This (or Follow if you haven't followed this proposal). Why is the image cropped?

Title: Lower the bar for downvoting on Meta.SE
Body:
User Disenfranchisement

When a user notices a featured Meta.SE topic in their own site's sidebar that impacts them, and they click through to Meta.SE, a significant number of them, regardless of their expertise in their subject and site, cannot show their disagreement with the change by downvoting because they have not already participated in Meta.SE enough to downvote.

Evidence

The results of this user disenfranchisement are clear. You have announcements with an upvote/downvote record of 594/124 while the highest voted response is negative towards the proposal, and has 629/26 votes.

It is then trivial to assume that because the main post's votes are largely positive, there must be significant support for the proposal, when the reality is that there is significant unhappiness about the proposal, but we've disenfranchised users so they are unable to express it appropriately. Further, we cannot simply assume that the 629 negative cancel out the 594 positive and assume half the people don't like the proposal because it's possible to vote positively for the proposal, then after reading the later discussion changing one's mind and being unable to change their vote on the proposal until someone edits it (they certainly can't edit it!).

Work-arounds

While there are some work-arounds, such as hosting discussions on individual metas and trying to bring those responses to the table, as well as upvoting the negative responses in the hopes that people they trust pay attention, this is inadequate. In such cases people still assert that there is more positive support for such a proposal than negative disapproval.

Meta is murder different

Meta is actually another Stack Exchange site for experts about Stack Exchange, and so it makes sense to have some bars for participation in terms of how new users can contribute and gain reputation.

As you notice, though, there are things discussed here that have significant, direct impact on other sites.

Further, downvotes on Meta are often used to indicate disagreement - in the same way we originally used Uservoice to prioritize features and express agreement and disagrement. To some degree it's a priority queue, but it's terribly unbalanced if the vast majority of our users can only put positive pressure on change proposals.

Conclusion and recommendation

Down-voting should not be tied to the high level of reputation currently required - you don't need Meta.SE expertise to evaluate the usefulness of an idea to you or your site. On a regular site you vote according to truthiness, but here you vote according to usefulness given your perspective/experience.

Meta.SE should lower the bar for downvoting, making it equivalent to upvoting.

Because there is still a 2 rep cost associated with downvoting, this will still be self-limiting, and prevent significant abuse. Once a person downvotes significantly, they will have to also participate in other ways to continue to downvote.

Title: Vote counts can't fit the minus sign
Body:
The vote counts seem to have enough room to accomodate 3 digits and a negative sign:

However when the score is expanded to show +/- vote counts...

The minus sign gets cropped off somehow.

Title: It would have been nice to know that shared links include my user id
Body:
I noticed that every short-link/permalink that I share while I'm logged in includes my user id.

It would have been really nice if the UI had highlighted this fact in the link sharing popup so that people who don't always intend to share their identity elsewhere can remain secure knowing that they haven't.

Title: Is a license change necessary?
Body:
So as we all well know, Stack Exchange has been proposing that we change the license used for code to MIT.

Is this change, or a change to any other license for code, necessary at all?

If it is, why? What problem does the license change solve, in detail? If we can get some of this explained, then it may be easier to explain when the next iteration comes around why this is necessary.

Title: Provide the ability to change API search tag constraint
Body:
There was a feature request (or maybe it was an implementation) recently that asked for searches containing tags to use an OR constraint, rather than require all tags searched to be on the question.

I'd like to ask for something similar in the API, for the /2.2/search route's tagged parameter - but instead of enforcing an OR constraint, can we be allowed to choose whether it's OR or AND?

Title: Which help pages can be changed, by a site's community moderator?
Body:
Each site's help center contains a number of help pages. Which of these can be edited for a specific site by a community moderator on that site?

(To be clear, I am asking about ♦-moderators, not community managers or Stack Exchange employees.)

Title: Making small edits to my posts all the time bumps them to top; I need to stop, right?
Body:
I have a habit of repeatedly editing my own posts. I like to aim for perfection. Partly since the site encourages answering my own questions and treating that like a blog post.

I notice this bumps my posts, and I feel guilty :(.

So I need to try easing off on editing simply for optimal word choice. Maybe avoid trivial edits unless there was also a substantial change in the last 5 minutes. Am I right in thinking that would be preferable?

Title: Synchronize mod status with chatroom ownership
Body:
As far as I can tell, changes in mod status -- becoming a mod, or ceasing to be -- does not immediately affect which rooms that user owns.

When a site enters beta and gets a chatroom, the pro-tem mods are installed as owners of the site room, and the mod-only room of that site.

However, later changes in the mod team are not reflected in the list of owners, meaning that ex-mods retain access (unless any of the other owners/mods remember to take action), and new mods may not have full control (I'm not sure if they are chat-almighty by being mods, anyway).

I think that room ownership of site rooms should be synced with the moderator list automatically.

Title: How far does an IP block reach?
Body:
I understand that if you post something which gets flagged with an offensive flag and if that offensive flag gets validated that the user whose post is in question gets deleted, the user who posted the offensive post gets -100 rep, and also if the user gets a certain amount of offensive flags which get validated, then the user gets an IP block.

However what I am not sure about is how far the IP block reaches, when a user gets it, is it permanent? Does it only mean that nobody on that IP can post (which seems a little harsh if there are other users on that IP which don't post offensive things)? Or does it actually block them from seeing the site? And does it only stop them from doing stuff on that certain SE site, or is it all of them?

Title: Can the "Vote to close" button be placed more conveniently in the popup in the mobile layout?
Body:
When a question received close votes for being a duplicate and one also casts a close vote for that reason, previously suggested duplicates can be selected.

That's convenient. The preview of the duplicate is expanded to show the entire question and all answers, which helps reviewing this possible duplicate.

The big amount of additionally displayed content pushes the submit button very far down. It's often sufficient to read the other question or a few answers to decide if it is indeed a duplicate.

All the convenience of being able to click on a previous suggestion is eliminated by the need to scroll all the way down to the bottom of the pop-up in order to click on the submit button.

Some possible solutions I could think of:

  • position the button near the top
  • create multiple buttons and place one below the question and every answer
  • move the button along when scrolling the window
  • keep the height of the popup constant and let the content of the question expand in its own scrollable environment

Title: How to list which posts did I review "wrongly"?
Body:
I want to know when the review consensus was different than the one I voted for. For simplicity, I'd call that situation that "I was wrong".

This has nothing to do with audits, I am talking about real reviews.

Right now I click through all items in Actions>Reviews. But that has two flaws:

  • I need to check every review, not just those where I was "wrong"
  • I need to check multiple times because it takes time for the review to be closed

It would be extremely useful for me to see the results but clicking through all reviews is very tedious. Is there a way? I mark this a feature request because I think there is not.

Title: Leaving a comment in review removes my upvotes on other comments
Body:
Sometimes while reviewing, I upvote an existing comment and then decide to add one of my own before moving on. Interestingly, once I add my comment, my upvotes on other comments disappear as if I had never made them - I can upvote them again, and am allowed to remove that second upvote.

I know for sure this behavior occurs in the First Posts, Late Answers, and Close Votes review queues, and I wouldn't be surprised if it affects all queues.

Title: Is there an official position on reverse enginering and doing actions against EULAs?
Body:
I'm most of the time on gamedev.se, and, once in a while, we get questions like this:

I'd like to do a fan game of the SNES game XYZ. How can I extract the images from it?

I'm pretty sure EULAs for games prevent users from doing some kind of reverse engineering on their games.

While not being illegal, I feel that this kind of behaviour is not professional, and thus should not be tolerated.

So, is there an official position on reverse enginering and doing actions against EULAs? If so, what is it? Or is it a stack-by-stack policy? (And if not, should we have one, as this a grey zone and it makes moderation harder to do?)

Title: What should I do about questions that have a wrong preconception already in them
Body:
An example might be: "Why is the sky neon green?"

What should I do with such questions? Close as off-topic? Close as unclear? Downvote? Answer with (in this case) "It isn't, it's blue most of the time"?

I vaguely remember seeing a question about this but couldn't find it with a search, apologies if this has already been asked.

Title: How "Ask Question" links could be improved in SE sites?
Body:
I recently had to ask a question in StackOverflow, but I found difficult to find the ask question button. I suppose that asking a question is the main action an user will do in SE forums, and is difficult to find in some sites (SO, Programmers, Super User)

After noticing how difficult was to find the link (had to use browser search), I checked in other SE sites and found that they have external consistency (buttons are located top right), but for an user that is not familiarized with this pattern, it could be difficult to find the button.

How can this be improved? I found easier to find the button in http://ux.stackexchange.com and http://travel.stackexchange.com

Title: User posted their password!
Body: An asker on a question I am working on posted some code that contains their site password if you look deeply at it. How can I alert the user to take this down without posting it publicly on the question, thus calling even more attention to it?

Title: The number of posts to review stopped making any sense since I hit 10k rep
Body:
Though correlation doesn't imply causation I think there's a link between me hitting 10k rep and seeing this review count in the top bar:

It makes no sense at all and is always more than 200. This even happens when I reviewed 20 of almost each queue and certainly had nothing to review. The count doesn't add up even if I subtract 200 from the number.

What does the number exactly mean? If it's broken I'm gonna ad-block it because it harms my attention for no reason.

Here's an example screenshot of actual numbers

Title: Login on Safari on Mac OS X (El Capitan)
Body:
I had an little issue when loggin in with Safari on Mac OS X (El Capitan).

When entering the password in Safari, there is a key symbol that lets you choose among any password that is stored in your keychain. This button interferes with the "forgot?" button that Stack Exchange adds and you can't press the Safari button.

Please move this "forgot?" button below the text field, like most other sites implement this.

Title: Is there a secret fake Mongolian Stack Overflow?
Body:
From a tweet:

@[redacted] @[also redacted] Mongolian is the "fake" language we use when localizing #stackoverflow #trivia

Is there an actual fake Mongolian Stack Overflow where you play around with localisation? Or is it just a placeholder in conversations, like "Does Similar Questions get localised in the Mongolian Stack Overflow?"?

If it exists, does it use Mongolian Cyrillic, or Mongolian script, which is a vertical script?

Title: Add notice contents to the timeline
Body:
Bounties are listed in the timeline now, but not the bounty message. Bounty messages are posted as notices, and moderators can post other notices too.

I've had to remove a bounty from a question today, one with a very verbose notice. That notice was the reason I removed the bounty (it was basically asking a new question), and I'd like to have had that notice preserved for future auditing.

Please add the notice text to the timeline, at least for moderators if not for all users.

Title: What are the general guidelines for submitting feature request?
Body: When someone wants to request a feature, how should they go about asking it?

Title: When should questions be migrated?
Body:
A question was posted on site X, but it looks like it might be suitable on site Y. How should moderators and close-voters decide whether to migrate it to site Y? What criteria should be used?

This was a subject of a lengthy discussion among multiple site mods, and it became clear there is a broad range of opinions about this subject and apparently no definitive reference outlining an approach. So, this is an attempt to create a reference question, in hopes that it generates answers that help outline possible ways to think about this.

Title: I possibly need someone who knows about C++ to translate me a chinese article which would solve my current problem. Where do I ask this question?
Body:
I am not sure where to put this question in, so I prefer to ask here first.

Currently, I am trying to solve an issue with C++ / WTL, and after quite some research I only found a chinese article with a possible solution: 

注意Member type需要手工输入 CHyperLink

DDX type必须使用Control，不能使用Control Handler。否则编译时会出现下面错误。

Error 1 error C2679: binary '=' : no operator found which takes a right-hand operand of type 'ATL::CWindow' (or there is no acceptable conversion)

from this Website

However, I don't even speak the slightest of chinese. I tried translating it, but I feel like there's quite a lot of important technical context missing, and I can't work with what I am given by translation.

Where would I ask this question? I don't think stackoverflow would be a proper place for that?

Title: How can I view all questions asked on my account?
Body:
I'd like to view all my questions on all my sites at once. Is there a way to do this?

Currently, when I click on the "Questions" tab in my profile, it only shows me the questions I've asked on that site.

Title: Editing a previous message posts a new one instead
Body:
When editing a message in the new mobile chat, a new message is posted instead of replacing the edited one.

Steps I followed to reproduce:

  • I posted a message in (new mobile) chat.
  • Then I selected the message and clicked the pencil icon in the menu bar.
  • The previous message was displayed, and I edited it, and then clicked the pencil button on the side.
  • Instead of editing the message, a new message was posted.

I believe this is a bug.

Title: I don't know my info
Body: I signed up for stack exchange about a year and a half ago, and have it signed in on my phone and can (clearly) ask questions. I want to sign in on my laptop, but it keeps saying that there is no account under any of my e-mail addresses, and none of the external sign ins are associated with my account. Is there any way I can get into my account, or an I just going to have to start over?

Title: Allow deselecting a message by tapping them again
Body:
It's great that we can access more options by tapping on a message. But what about a tap-to-deselect? At the moment, we have to press the close button on the top left of the screen.

Advantages:

  • Seems intuitive to me. I keep trying to do it!
  • Easier for one-handed operation for right-handed people.

Disadvantages:

Title: "Participating" Proposals button on Area51 homepage sidebar
Body:
Whenever I want to check up on proposals I'm following on Area51, I have to go to Area51, go to my user page by clicking my profile icon at the top of the screen, switch to the "Info" tab, and then scroll down to find proposals I'm following / committed to. It's not too much work, but it seems like more work than necessary for the most frequent thing you'll do on Area51 (check up on proposals you're interested in). It'd be nice if there was a "Participating" button on the sidebar for a quick way to get a breif overview of all of the proposals you were following, because, to my knowledge, the next quickest way to do that is to visit the Info section of your profile.

Here's some concept art:

Title: New mobile chat: Text entry box is too small
Body:
I've been testing the new mobile chat, and I've found that the text entry box is too small, which makes writing longer messages difficult.

It's only large enough to show one line, so if my message spans more than one line, the other lines are cut off completely. The actual text area also does not fill the entire space at the bottom of the screen, leaving a significant number of pixels unused. Slightly expanding the text box vertically would significantly improve its usability.

(Firefox on Android, using both a Nexus 5X and Nexus 9.)

Title: Very long code blocks are truncated and unreadable in the new mobile chat (Firefox-only)
Body:
See sandbox: https://chat.stackexchange.com/transcript/message/27182401#27182401

This occurs in Firefox (both desktop and mobile/Android). Code blocks that are too long are truncated (hidden). Chrome seems to wrap as old mobile did. Making it scrollable would also work.

Inline-code (via backticks) wrap correctly in Firefox.

Screenshot (from desktop, but mobile does the same thing):

Title: Why do most scripts (eg:serial downvote detecting) run at 3am?
Body: As I know, many scripts, such as serial downvote detecting, tag clearing, data caching, run at 3am, but why they run at 3am instead of 0am or at other period? Is it because the system is not busy at 3am? Or there are security reasons for that?

Title: Allow custom flagging a post after (a still pending) flag as VLQ/NAA
Body:
I have flagged an initial version of a post as Not an answer, which at the site seems okay, since it was more a comment (user uses an outdated browser which isn't supported and doesn't allow adding comments).

Now, the user has edited the post a number of times editing in some stuff that I consider inappropriate. To explain that better than the 'rude/abusive' flag, I wanted to custom flag that post and explain in detail why I think the post is not appropriate and something about the history of that post that was not very obvious (so I really needed to custom flag it).

The flag dialog now says I have already flagged that post, which is true, however my NAA flag shouldn't prevent me from custom flagging it (in my opinion).

I propose custom flagging to be allowed, even if you raised a NAA flag (that one could be automatically invalided, if necessary / possible).

Just to make sure: I have read some related questions on this and those were either bug reports or discussion related to flagging and the flag dialog. This is a feature request to allow custom flagging.

Title: How to see all the questions I have 'view'ed earlier?
Body: I wish to see all the questions I have 'view'ed so far. I remember seeing a good question on concurrency, but I am not able to google it again. I had neither voted on it or favorited it as well. Any help?

Title: Should I delete comments on deleted answers?
Body:
When I provide an answer on Stack Overflow, it might be incorrect, or OP has further requests, so it could be end up with lots of comments below it. And eventually I deleted the answer for many reasons.

Is it a good practice to delete all my comments? I also tired a couple of times to flag other comments, but they always get "declined" in the flag history. Is it normal?

I understand 10k users can view deleted answers, so I often replace the content of my deleted answer with a placehoder text like "---deleted---" etc. Just to avoid people to see the incorrect content. Is that a good thing to do? Because I often see many deleted answers on a page, and they could take a large space of the page, makes it harder to find the real useful information.

Title: New mobile chat interface broken on UC Browser HD for Android
Body:
The new mobile chat interface is very buggy on UC Browser HD for Android. A minor problem is shown in the screenshot below:

as you can see, the "search room" text is distorted. More importantly:

  • I can't click click on the search bar to actually search for something.
  • I can't scroll down or up, I only get one screenful of messages.
  • I can't actually chat; there's no text box for chatting.
  • Clicking on a message only selects it, the pop up menu with available actions that appears when using chrome is absent.

I tested this on a Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro 10.1 (SM-T520). On my phone, a Galaxy Express 2 (SM-G3815) the new interface doesn't even load (I'll be posting a separate bug report for that once I've made sure it's reproducible) so I can't check.

Title: Focus rectangle on submit button after tapping it
Body:
After tapping the message submit button in the new mobile design, it gets a focus rectangle:

I don't think it should be there. Chrome browser under android LG G3 device, if it matters.

Title: "(deleted)" is a bit misleading when something like a close vote has been accepted
Body:
Currently in the history for one's votes it says (deleted) if a vote has either been accepted, denied, or deleted.

So, for instance if I cast a close vote on a question and the question is closed, it will look like this:

Which is slightly confusing and may be misleading to some as they may think that the close vote was rejected in some way. It also does this for reopen votes, delete, and undelete votes, basically it does it for any vote if it's been accepted, rejected (in some way), or deleted (like if I cast a close vote, and then retract it).

So I think that the text displayed about the status of the vote should be more descriptive, so that it says (deleted), (denied), and (accepted).

Title: Request to allow copy-paste image from snipping tool into question/answer
Body:
Windows snipping tool has a little "copy" button, it looks like this:

If you're composing and email in gmail, you can paste right into your email with Ctrl-V after copying from the snipping tool with that button. It's very convenient.

At StackExchange sites, I have to save the snip to my hard drive first (as far as I know). The drag-and-drop functionality you have now is great for images on my hard drive. But allowing copy paste would save me from having to save the snip, and then delete it.

Title: How can I get back my account in a SE site?
Body:
First of all, I'd like to make it clear that I've tried to post it on the Math-meta site, since this question could fit better there, but I'm not allowed because I'm new and don't have enpugh reputation yet.

11 days ago I signed up in Math-SE, with my e- mail. I've been using it,asking and answering questions without any problem; but it seems that I forgot to confirm my e-mail by clicking the link that is given by mail when you sign up. So yesterday, when I opened Chrome, I was logged out, and when I tried to log in, the page would say :" We could not find an account with that e-mail".

I don't know what to do to get my account back; since the options for recovery of your account assumes your mail is registered, and mine's not.

thanks!

Title: Include question closure in heartbeat
Body:
The heartbeat now includes post deletion (it updates live when a post is deleted), which was added recently (I still cannot find a reference for the new addition).

Can we please also have the closure of questions included in the heartbeat?

Meaning that if a question is closed while I'm viewing it, a banner will pop up or some such UX goodness to tell me that the question is now closed.

I know that there is something if I'm writing an answer and the question gets closed, but I'm usually not writing answers to questions when they are being closed, I'm usually monitoring their status until they are closed.

This would save Stack Exchange the overhead of me spamming F5 until the question is closed.

Title: Inconsistent actions offered to moderators for flagged comments
Body:
I noticed a moderator flag on the "action bar" and visited the page to see what it was, see image:

You will notice that there are three possible actions for this report flagged as "not an answer":

  • Convert to comment
  • No further action ...
  • Delete answer

Plus, presumably, I can ignore the report altogether.

Now before choosing one of the above I click on the link to visit the problem page. At the bottom of the page a "pop-up" box appears, overlaying the bottom of the question/answer page, like this:

Suddenly there are only two actions:

  • No action needed ...
  • Close

Why do the other two actions that could be taken on this answer not appear, like this (made-up example):

It seems inconsistent that on one page you can do four things (if you count doing nothing) and on the other page you can do two things.

Whatever arguments there might be for having three buttons, or one button, or some other thing, surely they should at least be consistent?

Title: Indicate number of items in meta review queues when displayed from main review page
Body:
When viewing the review page on main, each queue has a number next to it indicating how many items remain. At the end of the list of queues is a link to the meta review page, but this gives no indication of whether there are any meta items to review:

Since many sites have very few reviews in the meta queue, clicking through to find out if there are meta reviews usually gives a negative result, giving an incentive to stop checking. If there was a number, simply showing the total number of meta reviews (the sum of the individual meta review queues), then on those occasions when a meta review appears, it would be picked up more quickly as no one would need to check the meta review page to notice it.

Title: Minor comment indentation glitch (on SO)
Body:
I've noticed this a few times, never seen quite what causes it: A comment on a question can be markedly more indented than normal (on Chrome). I've taken a screenshot and drawn a vertical blue line from comments on the first answer up to the comment on the question that's indented, and highlighted the gap in red:

I had flagged the comment as obsolete (since it's replying to a now-deleted comment), if that's relevant.

FWIW, here's the current state of that comment's row in the DOM:

<tr id="comment-58065986" class="comment ">
    <td>
        <table>
            <tbody>
                <tr>
                    <td class=" comment-score">
                          
                    </td>
                    <td>
                        <div class="comment-flag flag-on comment-flag-indicator" title="You have already flagged this comment">flag</div>
                    </td>
                </tr>
            </tbody>
        </table>
    </td>
    <td class="comment-text">
        <div style="display: block;" class="comment-body">
            <span class="comment-copy">@ShrikanthBuds, why?</span> – 
            <a href="/users/487524/epoch" title="9557 reputation" class="comment-user">epoch</a>
            <span class="comment-date" dir="ltr"><a class="comment-link" href="#comment58065986_35174255"><span title="2016-02-03 10:25:16Z" class="relativetime-clean">10 mins ago</span></a>
            </span>
        </div>
    </td>
</tr>

I'd link to the question, but the comment has already been deleted.

This is on Stack Overflow.

Title: View Favorites from iOS app
Body: Can posts that have been favorited be viewed in a list on the iOS app similar to the desktop web version? If not, I'd like to request such a feature.

Title: Allow moderators to edit the sidebar text on the ask page
Body:
TL;DR: Moderators should be given the ability to edit the sidebar text on /questions/ask.

Moderators can edit various documents and texts around their sites that the community can't. The help center's /on-topic page is a good example of this. This is good, because it lets the community make changes to their documentation faster than any other process would allow.

I propose that this functionality be extended to the sidebar on the ask page.

What's the Problem?

The 'problem' with the current system isn't so much of a problem as an inefficiency.

To edit that text, the current method is:

  • create a meta post to confirm with the community that they want this to happen, and to get the wording of the text down
  • go bug a community manager to edit the text for you
  • wait for the edit to come through

Now, while this isn't a massive problem, it does reduce communities' self-sufficiency and efficiency, which can in turn be a problem when sites want to take action on question quality and this turns out to be a holding point.

I've seen a couple of cases recently where sites have had that text edited, which as with many CM requests is unpredictable - without any disrespect to the CM's, they have many tasks on their plates and can't always deal with individual issues like this straight away. It can take a while for things to happen, in some cases.

What's the Solution?

The current mod-editing functionality could be extended to cover this text as well. If you haven't figured it out yet, it's this I'm talking about:

This would allow mods to edit the text there without having to go through CM requests.

This would solve the issue - moderators are more familiar with their sites, scopes, and communities than the CM's are. This is an advantage because it removes the time taken for a CM to familiarise themselves with a site or issue, then evaluate the proposal, then provide feedback or action.

I have been told of a couple of potential reasons why this shouldn't happen:

  • There's generally no reason to be making rapid changes to that text.
    Neither is there a reason to do so in the help center. Mods have access to edit the help center, and that's a very useful feature. I don't think I've heard of any cases of abuse of it?

  • It's something everyone asking sees, and the CM's want to be on top of it.
    That is, of course, up to the CM's. However, I believe that currently, when mods edit the help center, the CM's are pinged in some way (email, inbox, I don't know). Perhaps it would be a good idea, if mods were given this access, to extend this ping too? When a mod edits the text, a CM can be pinged about it and review it.

Some other thoughts I had about the implementation of this:

  • Perhaps it could be rate-limited, so that it can't be edited very frequently. Use a long rolling rate limit - one edit per 24 hours?
  • Perhaps something similar could be used for edits here as for revision redactions and close reason additions? When a mod edits the text, generate an auto-flag for another mod to review.

Title: Is there some way to see all of a user's messages in a chat room?
Body:
Here's the situation: I'm investigating a user's behaviour in a couple of chat rooms because I find the overall patterns concerning, and may need to direct some official attention their way discreetly. They haven't spoken there often, and I suspect a high % of their activity will be of interest.

Is there some way I can find the various instances of someone's activity in a room? Either their messages, or the days on which they have spoken, would be useful.

The best I can think of is to open up the Transcript and search it for very common words, but "the" turns up no results, and "you" isn't picking up much. I also tried Google ({username} site:chat.stackexchange.com/transcript/{roomnumber}), but that digs up a lot of false positives, and doesn't turn up incidents I know are there (I was there for them).

Title: Links from historical election pages point to current resources
Body:
On election pages, there is a short section with links to additional resources. As an example, here is the relevant part for the 2013 Stack Overflow moderator election:

Apparently, however, the content for that section is shared among all past and present elections for a site. Therefore, the Election chat room and The candidates answer your questions links lead to the relevant pages for the latest election (in the case of Stack Overflow, the fall 2015 election); the overview linked from More information about the candidates also seems to provide information only about the latest election. The Meta link is, of course, timeless.

This is not limited to Stack Overflow, although some sites appear to omit this section altogether (e.g. DBA SE has it, Physics SE not).

Ideally, the links should lead to the resources relevant for each election. If this is not possible (or worth the effort), the section shouldn’t be displayed at all.

Title: Duplicate google results
Body:
Doing a search for "Couldn't find" "_destroy" rails gave both http://stackoverflow.com/questions/18835422/rails-4-nested-attributes-couldnt-find-tag-with-id-for-person-with-id and http://stackoverflow.com/questions/18835422/rails-4-nested-attributes-couldnt-find-tag-with-id-for-person-with-id/19863805 in google's list of results.

I don't know whether it's Google's fault or Stack Exchange's fault, but I assume things working well is more important to Stack Exchange than to Google.

Title: New mobile chat: the "Loading room" message looks bad
Body:
On the new mobile chat, the "Loading [Room name], Just a second" message looks old, out of place and bad:

In fact, it was taken directly from the old chat interface:

It should loose the beige background and the shadow on the box IMO.

(As a technical side note: why not get rid of it entirely, and embed the initial messages and other data in the page, so that it does not need to make an additional network request ?)

Title: Careers search for "golang" returns results unrelated to golang or [go]
Body:
A Careers search for "golang" the text:

http://careers.stackoverflow.com/jobs?searchTerm=golang&location=united+states&range=20&distanceUnits=Km&allowsremote=true

appears to return results unrelated to golang:

http://careers.stackoverflow.com/jobs/104305/front-end-developer-go-fish-digital?searchTerm=golang&offset=1&distanceunits=Km&location=united%20states&range=20

Front End Developer $60,000 - 75,000
Go Fish Digital
Tysons, VA Remote
jquery css php mysql html5
Mid-Level

As "[golang]" the tag expands to the "[go]" tag, I guess one would, in fact, expect that jobs tagged w/ "[go]" should be included, too, however, I think it's a bug to parse the input as a tag, yet use the results of such expansion to search for stuff completely unrelated to "golang" the text or "[go]" the tag, resulting in a whole bunch of false positives.

Title: network answers in Careers should have bounty information, too
Body:
It appears that Careers shows whether an answer was accepted or not (in addition to the vote count), but doesn't show whether a bounty was won. That could be improved.

Additionally, it's very difficult to add more answers to the Careers profile -- the drop-down menu for selectively adding each answer individually (which appears to be he only way to add more answers) is missing acceptance state (even though it's shown after you add it).

Title: Cannot use code block directly below list
Body:
When writing a post with a code, it is not possible to use block code directly after a list.

  • This is a list
  • It contains some items

  • It's goal is to show that I can't use code below

    This is a code sample that is not being parsed.

If I write anything

I can use code now.

  • The only place I can't use code is right after a list.

    Like here, for instance

    This is also code that is not being parse

    This is code too.

This is normal text.

This is code.

Title: How to show one result per question on search?
Body:
Let's say that I search for keyword X. Search results will show me all questions or answers that contain X in them.

However, this means that for a given question Q, if X is present in both the question part of Q and an answer to Q, search will show me two results.

Is there way to configure the search, so that in such a scenario, search will show only one result?

Title: Allow the ability to search for words which are the names of tags without being forced to only search for posts with those tags
Body:
For instance, sometimes I want to search for all posts which mention security, however when I put that into the search it immediately puts these [] around it and searches for all posts with that tag instead. Now in some cases this may be useful, however not all those who put the word security into their post have also put the security tag, so then it becomes impossible to search for those posts without that tag, but with that word in them.

And of course I was just using security as an example, I find this incredibly annoying when searching for any word which is also the name of a tag when I am not looking for all the posts that have that tag, but rather just that word.

So I suggest that there should either be an override such as putting, say --- before and after the word like this in the search ---security--- so that it doesn't treat it as a tag, or if one does not put the word in [] in the search, for it to perhaps suggest those tags, or tell you that in order to search for tags you have to put the [] around each one, but not to actually automatically do it for you and thus prevent you from just searching for the word normally, rather than as a tag.

Title: User scores are out of order in the "week" tab
Body:
When a new week recently began, I noticed something strange in the "week" tab:

I know this is just a bug "feature" with caching, but I wonder why an update to the scores on this page does not also just apply the correct order. Why are the two types of updates separated?

Title: How do I find an appropriate tag to use?
Body:
Sometimes I have no idea what tag to use on my questions. I look at the "popular tags" list but none of them are appropriate. I type a few characters of some words that describe what my question is about but none of the suggestions are right either. Sometimes I'm lucky and a good tag will pop up because the three or four letters I typed in are in the middle of that tag, but this happens rarely.

Most of the time I will find a tag that sort-of fits and post my question. A lot of the time someone more knowledgeable than me will edit my question by adding the correct tags (and possibly removing the original tag). Should I keep doing this or is there some other way of finding appropriate tags that I'm not yet aware of?

Title: Markdown Editor Toolbar missing?
Body:
Recently, sometimes, whenever I edit / create, a post the markdown buttons / preview seem to be missing:

In the console. Markdown and StackExchange.MarkdownEditor are both undefined. I don't see a script tag with wmd.en.js at all either so maybe something's not loading? Sometimes refreshing fixes it, which makes it even more weird.

Title: Reviewer badge - why does the value get changed to much less so often?
Body: For months I had over 150-160 reviews shown in my progress for Reviewer badge. In recent days it got rewinded multiple time reaching values of 10, 16 and 20. I guess I don't understand something when it comes to review queues so I would like some pointers what is going on here. If progress gets reset every once in a while why doesn't it reset to 0 (I had days when I hadn't reviewed any material on SO yet the progress remained)? I'm not a badge grinder and frankly I use the review indicator as a nice overview how much I've done so far (current day, week etc.). I'm just interested what is going on here?

Title: Redirect /ask to /questions/ask for convenience
Body:
Chrome autocompleted stackoverflow.com, but didn't provide any indication the correct URL was /questions/ask, not /ask, so I had no idea the former was the correct URL.

Really small thing, but it would be kinda cool/neat if the system autoredirected the URL.

Title: Is there a way to ask for "Getting Started" information-source recommendations that is not off-topic
Body: I need to learn about a paradigm totally new to me. I don't have enough experience to formulate specific questions yet. The area is one which has undergone significant change over the years. Web searches return info on mostly abandoned approaches, and published books on the subject are outdated, which, as a novice in the area, I don't discover until I've wasted time exploring the abandoned approach or wasted time and money on the outdated book(s). Is there a way to ask for pointers to online "Getting Started" resources that won't immediately get shut down as off-topic?

Title: When suggesting edits, link to review does not appear on suggested tag wiki edits
Body:
When you perform an edit on a normal post, a notice appears to show that your edit has been placed in the review queue:

This notice contains a link to the review item, so you can track its progress.

However the notice that appears when you edit a tag wiki or excerpt does not contain this link:

Can a link to the review item please be added to the notice?

Title: Primary Election Statistics: Query
Body:
There is a moderator election on Worldbuilding right now, and we are in the primary part of the election.

We were wondering whether it was possible to see the evolution of the votes as a function of time using a query like SEDE. Or are these data not available to users?

Title: Achievement doesn't collapse when opening your profile using the widget
Body:
The achievement box doesn't close when opening your profile using the widget, this clearly looks like a bug:

This bug can be reproduced 100 % out of the time.

Using application version 1.0.82.

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Open StackExchange and click archievements

  2. Go to your home page using the home button on your phone

  3. Use the widget to open StackExchange again

  4. Observe the bug

Title: careers, github project is hidden
Body:
For some reason http://careers.stackoverflow.com says:

Hidden We couldn't find any commits you've made to this project.

For https://github.com/Karaage-Cluster/karaage/commits/master

This is just a bit weird, because I have made a lot of commits to this project, and github is correctly seeing them as my commits.

Possibly problem is the commits were made with my old email address. My research seems to suggest this shouldn't matter though, as long as github can associate it to my user.

Title: Badges from other sites look like reels
Body:
Not a big deal but I thought I'd report it:

While I vist movies and TV, all my badges from other sites look like reels. I suppose whenever a site used a custom badge icon, it'll end up looking like that.

Title: How to ask which (sub)site to ask a question in when you've just made an account?
Body:
I've got a question that seemed to fall between two of the stack-exchange sites ('Programmers' and 'Workplace'). Reading the rules carefully, I could cross one of them off my list (it's very clear the question is inappropriate for 'Programmers' from the rules there).

So, reading the rules of this site says to ask in the meta of the specific subsite if the rules seem unclear. Except that requires 5 reputation.

This is probably not much, but it seems a bit 'gamey'/cynical to either think of a great question/answer just so I can get my meta-question answered.

My apologies if this seems out of place, but my original question now seems to have generated a meta- and a meta-meta- question. I don't know where else to ask [ except maybe Douglas Hofstadter ;-) ]

In any case, my the meta-question would have been, in the Workplace-meta, wether the original question, which was 'Can I apply for a job as Embedded C++ Programmer with just normal C++ experience and an MSc. in CompSci?' can be asked in Workplace without bending the rules too much (which could maybe sort-of allow it if you read the rules somewhat leniently).

Title: Area 51 login issue
Body: I can login to Area 51 using my Google account, and everything seems fine at first. Until I try to participate, such as answering a question, voting, or creating a new question. At this point the login bar shows me as not logged in, and I am asked to create an account or login again. But when I do I get the crashed flying saucer error. Login works fine on other StackExchange communities. I tried different browsers, clearing cache, clearing cookies, loging out from Google itself, creating another account - no avail. Has anyone else seen this?

Title: Can Hot Network Questions honor tag filters?
Body:
If a particular community has a favorite tag, I would like for that question in the Hot Network Questions list to highlight. If I have a tag set to ignore, it will either grey out or not show at all (as determined by my preferences for that community and tag.)

It seems like there is some customization in this list because I've ignored certain communities and those do not show up in this list. It would be cool to take this one step further.

Title: Can we tell users that the Help Center is needed to be visited, not should
Body:
A lot of new users don't have much idea about how to ask or answer here at Stack Exchange. Then we get complaints that we are too strict and we are anti-new-user or some other conspiracy made up. But the thing is, the tour says:

Looking for more in-depth information about this site?

Clearly, this suggests that the Help Center is not necessary and everything in the tour is enough to ask a good question... NOT! Actually, comments directed to new users suggest that you are supposed to read the Help Center in the first place, so why not make the tour lead you in a path in which that it encourages you to read the important Help Center articles.

Let's do the following to all the tours:

  • Put links into its respective section

For example, in the "Ask questions about..." section, add the link to the asking articles or the "How do I ask a good question" article. Especially for the voting section, where most users misinterpret how votes are used as downvotes are not explained and there is no Help Center link attached to help curious users learn about the voting system.

  • Make the text next to the Help Center button more encouraging

Just change it to something like:

Please read the Help Center articles to improve everyone's experience at this site

So, can we add Help Center links into the tour and encourage new users to read those articles so they don't get confused and frustrated?

Title: Make it possible in 10 K tools to view all migrations to/from a specific site and give a summary
Body:
I love the 10K tools. They're a lot of fun to explore.

Recently, I was participating in a discussion on Science Fiction & Fantasy about migrations to Movies & TV. I'm not a big SFF user but I do have 10K tools on M&TV. In order to quantify the numbers of migrations, you can certainly view the list of question in the migration tool view but there doesn't seem to be a way to limit the list to a specific site only. This means that, while you can certainly manually count all of the migrations, you have to avoid counting questions from other sites.

What I am requesting is that you make it possible to limit the "migrated" page results to a specific site only. So, if I'm only interested in questions sent to M&TV from SFF, instead of this:

You would instead see something like this:

In addition, it would be super cool if you added a counter that would include stats on this limited page about the history of the migrations. Something along the lines of:

SFF migration stats:

  • Migrations here: 88
  • Migrations away: 21
  • Rejected here: 19
  • Rejected away: 1

This would give 10K users a quick overview on how the site's doing with migrations and, if there's a lot of rejected migrations, see what's needing to be fixed. It'd also make discussions like the one on SFF easier as you wouldn't have to manually count all of the migrations.

Title: Badge notifications do not open on Android app
Body: I click either of the "electorate" or "java" badges and just end up where I started if I click the "Open with Stack Exchange" option.

Title: Fast-track for marking own question as duplicate?
Body:
Alternative resource folders in Android Studio gets collapsed into one virtual folder

I posted this question. Dhawal found another question that basically asked the same thing, so I tried to close my question as a duplicate.

I had to suggest a close, wait for other people to review the close reason (my vote seems to have counted in this vote), and then I got the standard "this question has been marked as duplicate".

It seems like this is a good place to allow a fast-track. Marking your own question as a duplicate, if you have "enough" reputation, could skip the review queue.

Thoughts?

Title: Bug with display of uploaded screen shots from retina displays
Body:
I have a Mac with an internal retina display and an external regular-resolution display. If I do a screen shot on my external display and upload it to SO it looks great. But if I upload the screen shot from the retina, which has 2x the DPI, the picture on SO is twice the size it should be. I suspect that SO's HTML rendering engine is not looking at the DPI information embedded in the PNG.

How does this get fixed?

Title: Is it unethical and/or against rules to offer a solution for a fee, when the question is invalid?
Body:
I recently saw a question where someone asked for StackOverflow users to convert some Javascript code to PHP, since he didn't know how. Unsurprisingly, this questions was downvoted and flagged, as it's not what the site is for.

Would it be unethical and/or against the rules for a user to post a comment, offering to complete the requested task outside of SO (assuming it's a valid question, not a question such as a homework problem)? In essence, the user is offering to consult for the original poster and solve his problem.

Title: What is the proper community for GPL licence question?
Body: I would like to ask a question about a licence (GNU GPL) but, I am not sure which is the right community. I have already read many sources, including the official one and also the most frequent asked questions section. However, since this is a delicate matter and I would not want to ruin things, I want to make sure that I understood correctly. Also, not being a native english speaker causes me trouble when it comes to specific topics - like licences for example. Someone suggested me Superuser, but It did not seem like the right place.

Title: How can I get a user ranking sorted by question reputation?
Body:
On every stackexchange site you can rank the top (all time) users by total reputation.

Is it also possible to rank the top users only taking into account the reputation earned by questions (and not by answers)? If so, how to do it?

Title: How can I ask a specific moderator a question?
Body: I want to ask a specific moderator a question but I don't see any way to communicate directly with that person. How can I? My question is very specific to some internal nofollow rules this moderator mentioned, and am wondering if my website is blacklisted. Thus I don't really think it's a general question for posting on Meta (but maybe I'm wrong).

Title: Why do some PostHistory 'partner' events not match up?
Body:
There are some events that get logged in the PostHistory database that, as far as I can tell, always happen together:

  • a post gets merged: PostMergeSource, PostMergeDestination
  • a post is created: InitialBody, InitialTitle, InitialTags
  • similar for rollbacks: RollbackBody, RollbackTitle, RollbackTags

So why, when running a query over Worldbuilding's database, do I get these results?

Site            History Type Name       Instances
-------------------------------------------------
worldbuilding   Initial Body            25658
worldbuilding   Initial Title           4391
worldbuilding   Initial Tags            4391
worldbuilding   Rollback Body           49
worldbuilding   Rollback Title          23
worldbuilding   Rollback Tags           14
worldbuilding   Post Merge Destination  7
worldbuilding   Post Merge Source       1

It would seem to make sense for the numbers for each partner event to be the same, yet they're not. Why is this? Am I misinterpreting the events?

Data from the data dump imported into a MySQL database programmatically. Query:

SELECT
    `ph`.`Site` AS 'Site',
    `pht`.`Name` AS 'Type Name',
    COUNT(`ph`.`PostHistoryTypeId`) AS 'Instances'
FROM `PostHistory` AS `ph`
INNER JOIN `PostHistoryTypes` AS `pht` ON `ph`.`PostHistoryTypeId` = `pht`.`Id`
GROUP BY `ph`.`PostHistoryTypeId`, `ph`.`Site`
ORDER BY COUNT(`ph`.`PostHistoryTypeId`) DESC
LIMIT 1000;

Title: New mobile chat interfaces only partially scrolls on iPad
Body:
When I load chat on my iPad, it loads in the middle of the chat page. From there, I can scroll a little way in either direction, but I can't scroll all the way to the bottom or all the way to the top of the page.

This means I can't reach the input box at the bottom. I'm also unsure about whether there are supposed to be buttons at the top that I can see.

iOS 8 point something.

Title: Scrolling/content area issues on iOS 8.4
Body:
I'm using Safari on an iPhone 6, iOS 8.4 (yes, it's time to upgrade, but then how would we find these fun bugs?).

In the new mobile chat, the bottom part of the content area is often outside the bounds of the device and can't be scrolled to.

This is what I normally see when opening a room list: https://i.sstatic.net/QXRxx.png. And this is what happens if I take a screenshot while still touching the screen after scrolling to the bottom of the list: https://i.sstatic.net/s2NoZ.png. (The second I let go, the list "bounces" back to what you see in the first screenshot.)

Entering a room typically looks like this: https://i.sstatic.net/Lbt7v.png.

So, it appears that this behaviour occurs when Safari is still showing the browser navigation controls. There's no apparent way to dismiss those controls - scrolling or tapping anywhere on the screen doesn't do it - and they don't disappear on their own. I've been able to make it go away sometimes by scrolling until the input message box is in view, but then the top part of the page goes AWOL and there's no bringing it back: https://i.sstatic.net/V91VN.png.

If I reply to a specific message, the input box at the bottom sticks around like it should, and the messages scroll fine behind it... but the header disappears completely (similar to this screenshot, but without even a sliver of blue at the top).

Title: Chat homepage logo hard to read
Body:
On the site page of the chat the logo of StackExchange is hard to read:

If you look close, you see that there is a logo, but you need to loop very close to read it. I suggest we add a border to the logo, so we increase the contrast:

Sorry for poor image quality, I am not good with freehand line drawing

Title: Arial in front of font stack?
Body:
The current font stack on the SO main page is Arial, 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, sans-serif.

I'm confused why anyone would put Arial in front? Arial is generally considered poorly readable, and there are lots of good alternatives. E.g. Verdana or Tahoma are a big improvement and widely available.

Title: Tag badge count in Activity not updating
Body:
I just took these screenshots:

It has said this for a long time now (I now have 12 HP answers, not 9).

Why is my tag badge count not updating?

I have tried switching to tracking my next priv., and tracking a different tag badge. Nope.

Title: Mismatch between /reputation and epic badge tracker
Body:
There is a mismatch between what /reputation shows and my badge tracker for 'epic':

days represented 1269
rep cap was reached via rep from upvotes *only* on 42 days
earned at least 200 reputation on 45 days
earned 36 reputation from suggested edits

Meanwhile, the next badge tracker for epic shows 44/50:

This appears to be caused by a user who had voted on a post of mine that was deleted (I saw a 'deleted user -10' show up in my rep history a bit ago).

So, in /reputation, it shows:

-- 2016-02-10 rep +200  = 47281     
-- 2016-02-11 rep +215  = 47496

while the reputation log on the site shows:

The reason that I'm a bit below 200 was that I down voted several answers at 22:27.

However, the reputation (and thus badge tracking) hasn't caught up with the reputation that wasn't assigned after the deleted user's vote was removed.

You can see 21:34 down vote rep getting that rep 'back' with the 21:40 upvote (limited to +1 because of the rep cap).

However, the 22:27 down votes weren't 'recovered" with the 22:39 up vote to reset it back to 200 rep cap for the day, and thus a mismatch between the reputation cap information on /reputation and displayed for the epic badge tracking. I believe that this is from a user being deleted who had upvoted a post that day, and the removal process isn't properly recalculating the reputation for the purposes of badge tracking.

I will note the possibility that I've confused all of this and /reputation and the epic badge tracker are looking different things, but if that is the case, then there's still a bug (just that this isn't the underlying cause).

Title: What is the point of being able to hide a community on your profile when people can see it anyways?
Body:
Click:

Profile -> View network profile -> accounts or activity

Any community you've selected to "hide" from actually is not hidden here; it's completely public. I logged out and tested it on my own profile and nothing is actually hidden.

So, what's the point...? I'd really like to not have my profile tied to certain communities where things are more personal but I really don't want to have to make a separate account and lose my previous points/badges.

Title: Suggestion on the new description in the tag menu
Body:
The tag menu currently looks like this:

I would rather write that as one of the following:

  • at least one tag (such as limits, differential-equations, real-analysis), max 5 tags.
  • at least one tag, such as (limits), (differential-equations), (real-analysis), max 5 tags.
  • at least one tag, such as limits, differential-equations, real-analysis, max 5 tags.

Also, consider writing or instead of the last comma in the list.

I think that it is very weird how it is currently written, with such as outside the brackets, and the tags in the brackets.

Title: Menu organization appears to be random
Body:
When using the android app the menu organization of all the sites I have pinned appears to be random and not in the same order that I have them pinned on the website or iOs Version. I have tried to edit the list to get it to sync up and show in the proper order but that is not fixing it.

When I am in the list to edit the sites it is showing up there in the correct order but when I save the changes it goes back to the random order and not showing them in the expected order.

Title: Do auto-rejections of edits to orphan tag wikis count against me?
Body:
I edited the wiki of a tag that had only one question, and then somebody decided that the tag should not exist (they're probably right), they removed it from the question, and so the tag went away. The Suggested Edits review task was marked as "no longer reviewable" a couple hours later, without getting the necessary two Reject votes to dismiss it (not even an auto-rejection from Community). My count of rejected edits went up.

Was that a real rejection? Could such events impair my ability to edit tag wikis? I have more than 2K rep, but less than 20K.

Title: Is it acceptable to edit unsalvageable closed questions during tag cleanups?
Body:
At Super User, there is a huge ongoing campaign to destroy numerous bad tags. Boatloads of the questions with those tags are closed and not repairable. Sadly, they mostly have (mediocre) answers, and thus won't be automatically demolished by Community.

If we don't completely remove the tags, people will just keep using them, despite the obvious "Do not use this tag!" text in the excerpt. (Sigh.) I know editing terrible closed questions is lame because it puts them in the Reopen Votes queue and shoves them onto the front page, but these tags need to go. What should we do?

Title: Posted a bounty, now my reputation is too low to comment on the bounty question
Body:
My reputation was 89, then I posted a 50pt bounty on a question. Now with a reputation of 39, I cannot comment on that same question.

I believe further comments may help anyone trying to answer that question. Shouldn't I at least be able to comment on my open bounties?

Title: Chat search doesn't like apostrophes
Body:
Trying to search for words with ' characters in them in chat seems to return odd results.

For example searching for you're in the DMZ gives results that are all oneboxes .This seems to happen with any words that have an apostrophe in them.

It doesn't appear to be just stripping the ' characters and returning results for that as hel'lo returns no results where hello obviously does, also we're and were return different results.

Adding " characters round the search query doesn't seem to affect the results.

Title: Remove locked questions from hot questions
Body:
There's a question over on AskUbuntu... you know the one. Its a hot question. It also happens to be mod locked (not closed).

This means no new answers, no new comments, and no new votes.

Because of the excessive immaturity of users commenting on the question over there (and given the comments I saw that are likely deleted - from over here rather than there) and the... lets just say "provocatively phrased title" (which isn't at issue here - I have opinions about it though if you want to read about that elsewhere) it is locked. And that is the issue - it is locked. There is no interaction that anyone can have with the post from HNQ.

So remove it from the HNQ pool. There is no reason for a locked post to ever be in HNQ because of the lack of interaction that people can have with it. Protection says "no newbies". A locked post says "everyone, just go away." Please let that message apply to the HNQ pool.

And please, it is the very last thing I want showing up in a other community advertised post in a big box for my manager to see on the side of my browser.

Title: Are questions about locating a question on-topic on meta sites?
Body: I read a question years ago that really helped me in my programming career. I've been searching for hours today and can't find that original question. Would it be appropriate for me to ask on the relevant meta site a simple "Can you locate this quesiton for me" question? How much information do I need to provide?

Title: Should community wiki posts give +2 for suggested edits?
Body:
I just noticed that when an user with less than 100 rep suggests an edit on a community wiki post that gets approved, he gets +2 rep, just as for a suggested edit on a normal post.

However, I don't think that is fair. Nobody gets any rep for community wiki posts, so I think that the +2 is also misplaced.

On the other hand, I do not know whether we really should want to deprive some user with less than 100 rep of a little rep bonus.

Title: Old account "deleted" after login
Body: I used to have an account on various pages such as physics.stackexchange. I think I deleted an "openid login" from "edit profile & settings > my logins" and now I can't reach my "old" account. How can I fix this?

Body:
If I delete my OpenID account (not only way to log in, I use gmail), will I lose my stackoverflow account with it? (or any account i use with it)

Will it also remove the points I gained on other accounts for having the account?
