Title: Mobile chat: Selecting a message is very CPU-intensive under Firefox for Android, top bar animation likely culprit
Body:
On both my Nexus 5X and Nexus 9 running Firefox, selecting a message in the new mobile chat interface is extremely slow, pegging one CPU core for several seconds before the options appear in the top bar. It appears the animation used when showing the buttons in the top bar is difficult for Firefox to process. However, the animation plays smoothly under Chrome.

Is this something you can optimize for, or is Firefox to blame?

Title: Report Spam in Careers messages?
Body:
I realize that I can block an employer from contacting me. I have done so.

However, I'd like a way to report simply unfair use of the Careers systems. I received a poorly targeted recruitment attempt, I responded "Not Interested" and have received multiple followups "Can I just have a quick phone call to describe the roll..." "I'd love to tell you more..." etc.

After the second one, I found the "Block Employer" button. However, does this get any attention from the Careers site, in general? Is there any precedence for having your Careers account suspended because too many candidates have blocked you?

I'd like there to be a "Report Harassment" feature.

Title: By-elections or non-competitive recall of runners-up?
Body:
What is Stack Exchange's standing policy on filling vacancies left by retiring moderators? I'm confused by this post on M.SO - instead of 1 retiring moderator, two runners-up from the most recent election were recalled.

  • Are there any fixed rules on when to call a new election?
  • How can the decision to recall runners-up be made transparent (some runners-up may no longer want to be a moderator)?

Title: Don't make tag edits bump posts
Body:
Currently, editing a question's tags causes the question to be bumped to the top of the active tab. As I understand it, a question being bumped to the top of active is saying "Hey, community, something interesting/substantial happened to this question and you might want to check it out!". In my opinion, tag edits are not substantial enough to make it worth bumping the question, as they are mostly janitorial edits.

Consider the following common reasons for editing a question's tags:

  • The question was tagged incorrectly, by using an irrelevant tag or a combination of tags that don't make sense together
  • A tag that the question used has been retired or otherwise changed so that it no longer applies
  • A new tag has been created that would apply to the question, perhaps better than one or more of the current tags

All of these are janitorial edits - not substantial enough to warrant increased attention from the community, but rather something that needs to be done to keep the site clean. In the real world, it would be like getting an email at work every time the maintenance staff replaces a light bulb.

Title: Add the "Days Visited" metric to SEDE
Body:
I was writing a query on SEDE, when I noticed there was no "Days Visited" value.

I have circled the available user metrics, alas there is no Days Visited

While there is a CreationDate, this can't be used as accuretly in queries as me (and other people) create accounts on sites but then rarely visit the site.

I'd use this to weight user "scores" but they are probably a lot more uses for this.

Title: Allow customizable "magic links" on a per-site basis.
Body:
When writing comments, you can type certain "magic links" to link to common help pages. For example, if a new post is lacking a minimal, complete and verifiable example, I can just write

Please provide an [mvce].

And this will be replaced with the appropriate link. This is extremely convenient on Stack Overflow.

However, lots of the smaller sites have their own frequently used help pages. For example, on one of the sites I'm most active on, Programming Puzzles and Code-Golf, we have a meta post called "The Sandbox" where users can post challenges to get constructive feedback on how to make their challenge better. If I want to point a user to the sandbox, I have to open a new tab, search for the sandbox, copy and paste the url, and enter the hotlink syntax. It would be a lot more convenient if I could just write:

You should try posting this challenge to the [sandbox].

And the same idea is applicable on all of the smaller sites. Now, there are a lot of links like this that could be useful. Each site probably has a better picture of useful links for that site than anyone else would.

I propose we add a method to customize this for each site. A moderator can add a shortcut to a list of site-specific shortcuts like this:

[sandbox] = http://meta.codegolf.stackexchange.com/questions/2140/sandbox-for-proposed-challenges/
[unicorns] = http://meta.stackexchange.com/questions/37328/my-god-its-full-of-unicorns
[addiction] = http://meta.stackexchange.com/questions/11652/how-addicted-to-stack-overflow-are-you

And then if someone types one of the magic links on that particular site, it would hyperlink to the specified page.

Title: 1-year-old questions removed by Roomba: what happened if they are re-asked?
Body:
When a question is one-year-old, has received 0 upvote, 0 answer, fewer than 2 comments and not many visitors, it gets automatically removed.

Has anyone looked at what happened if such questions are re-asked? E.g., what percentage of then would they get an answer or some upvotes?

Title: Minor spacing bug on Area 51 in "Create New Discussion"
Body:
There seems to be a very minor spacing bug on Area 51 on discussions, when creating a new discussion:

At first the user is presented with the empty text field, which has the proposal, and link, already in the text field, like so:

and in text form

Proposal: [**XBee**][1]

  [1]:http://area51.stackexchange.com/proposals/96625/xbee

If the user then, adds a link (using the link button in the toolbar), then the second link has a space after the colon, whereas the first link did not, like so:

  [1]:http://area51.stackexchange.com/proposals/96625/xbee
  [2]: http://shop.oreilly.com/product/9780596807740.do

So the minor UI bug seems to be that the template for the pre-inserted proposal link is missing a space after the colon, a space that the add link button provides.

Title: Answering a duplicate question
Body:
Is it wrong to answer a question and also mark it as a duplicate?

I came across a question which I feel was duplicate so marked it so, but also posted an answer to the question. The reason I answered is I may have been able to remove a step for the question asker (they don't need to follow the link to the duplicate question) and I also just picked out the information they were specifically asking from the duplicate answer. However I worry I could be encouraging bad habits, as people feel they don't need to bother searching as they will get an answer regardless of whether their question is a duplicate.

Title: Fixing accidental account creation?
Body:
I come from the Worldbuilding community. I started using Stack Overflow to help learn my first programming language. The problem was, I signed up using my school google account. My account (user name was Dustin Jackson) quit working in that when I tried to log in with Google, it said that this google service is not allowed. I got fed up and created another account (my current one) with my personal Google (should have done that in the first place probable).

Everything has been fine now, and I have worked up a somewhat respectable number of good questions and answers on Worldbuilding (and an okay question or two on Stack Overflow). I have not even logged into my old Stackexchange account in 6 months. Then I read this Worldbuilding meta question and became concerned that someone would find out about my old account and think I was serial voting (I am not). I just want to know if there is any way I can clean up my old garbage and have my original account deleted? I would have asked on Worldbuilding Meta, but it seems like it could be useful to somebody from any Stack Exchange site, so I asked here.

Title: Fix the link of "# all time messages by (John Doe)" in chat
Body:
I've noticed that there is a link of "all time messages" either in the "frequently in rooms" or "currently in rooms" tabs in chat. But upon clicking on it, you will reach just to the usual transcript of the current day of this specific chat room. We already have an option to see the transcript, so this is either a bug or a misleading name for the link.

It will be actually really nice to see a certain users all messages - all time, as currently I'm not aware of a way of doing this (using search doesn't help because you also need to specify "containing" or "searching for". Neither the "recent" tab supplies all time information obviously).

Title: Automatically load comments when expanding post in flag queue
Body:
When processing comment flags, my workflow looks like this:

  1. Expand post
  2. Expand comments
  3. Delete comments
  4. Delete/dismiss flag

Which has one too many steps in it.

For comment flags, there's basically no case where I would expand the post and not immediately expand the comments. The system should do this for me and save me a step.

More specifically, on any 'commenty' flag, expanding the post in the flag queue should automatically expand the comments. It should do this on all comment flags, the 'too many comments' flags, and any other comment-ish flags I'm forgetting about.

Title: Where to ask case-specific questions about Android & fonts?
Body:
I have a specific list of fonts. Some are available in OTF files, others are available only in TTF files, whilst some are available in both. I want to install as many of them as possible (there are only about 5 in the list) on a smartphone with a specific Android version on it.

I want to ask, for each font listed, whether I should use TTF or OTF (where applicable), and how compatible said file type of said font is with this version of Android.

Nothing too complicated: just for each item, all I would need is either "OTF" or "TTF" and a short description of how compatible it would be for the version of Android I'd mention.

However, I'm not sure where to ask this question; which site would be best?

Title: Can we add the triple backticks feature for code formatting in markdown?
Body:
Disclaimer: My request is about using the same markdown format used in GitHub for code blocks and syntax highlighting.

In most recent markdown formatters, other than the 4 space indentations, we can create code samples by using triple ticks before and after the code block, for example:

```
this would become a code block
```

On the top of my head, I can think of 2 advantages:

Line length

Using backticks instead of the current format would allows us to gain 4 extra characters for each line of code inside the editor. I find this really advantageous as the editor currently allows 79 characters per line and 78 when the scroll bar is showing on the right.
This is just around the 80 character limit which most programming languages suggest. Thus giving us back those 4 extra characters would be quite nice in my opinion.

I'm currently using Firefox on Ubuntu, but I don't believe the character count per line would be much different on a different browser/OS, probably 1 extra or less character per line.

Syntax Highlighting and ease of use

Also, I find this style of formatting much simpler for use, especially when explicitly specifying the language for syntax highlighting.

Currently in SE, when we need to specify the language, we need to prepend the code block with the following unindented line <!-- language: js --> followed by empty line.
Example:

<!-- language: js -->

    // JavaScript code

In contrast, using the triple backticks format, we would use the much simpler:

```js
// JavaScript code
```

In my opinion, the format of the latter is much easier to remember.

P.S. I'm not asking to replace the current format with backticks, I'm asking if we can add this feature thus having 2 ways of formatting code.

Title: Quoting Code-Block with linewraps breaks the code
Body:
When quoting a code-block with lines wrapping due to their length, applying the blockquote-format results in breakage:

for (GroupMembers groupMembers : groupMembersList) {
    Notification notification = this.notificationService.createNotification(personid, true, "/section/listing/" + groupCanvas.getMcanvasid() + "?note=" + mnotes.getMnoticesid(), subject, text,
        type, groupSection.getMsectionid(), groupCanvas.getMcanvasid(), mnotes.getMnoticesid(), mnotes.getMnotecolor());

^ this code-block will result in the following markdown, when pressing Ctrl+Q after selecting it:

>     for (GroupMembers groupMembers : groupMembersList) {
>         Notification notification = this.notificationService.createNotification(personid, true,
> "/section/listing/" + groupCanvas.getMcanvasid() + "?note=" +
> mnotes.getMnoticesid(), subject, text,
>             type, groupSection.getMsectionid(), groupCanvas.getMcanvasid(), mnotes.getMnoticesid(),
> mnotes.getMnotecolor());

Instead it should result in the following:

>      for (GroupMembers groupMembers : groupMembersList) {
>                 Notification notification = this.notificationService.createNotification(personid, true, "/section/listing/" + groupCanvas.getMcanvasid() + "?note=" + mnotes.getMnoticesid(), subject, text,
>                         type, groupSection.getMsectionid(), groupCanvas.getMcanvasid(), mnotes.getMnoticesid(), mnotes.getMnotecolor());

The current algorithm for applying > seems a little overenthousiastic...

Title: Are proposals that are heavily downvoted ever get put under review and/or put into effect?
Body: If a proposal is downvoted heavily in Meta Stack Exchange, does the fact that it was downvoted heavily stop it from ever happening?

Namely the div .wrapper is resized according to the window's width, and the div .topbar and .footer get resized along with it, in .topbar's case exposing what's behind it.

Title: Area 51 discussions - Add to stackexchange app?

Why can you not access the discussion zone via the stackexchange app? I understand the full page with proposals.

I think it would be very useful to add the discussion page to the app and also help promote new proposals.

Title: Would it be possible that the search icon in the search box to actually trigger the search?

In lots of sites users can also click on the search icon instead of pressing enter to search. I think it would be a good idea to add this functionality here too and it wouldn't be hard at all.

Sometimes I copy something in the search box and I am used to use my mouse to search too. It seems a little bit strange for me to use the mouse to fill the search box and then push a button on the keyboard to search.

"has_more": true, "quota_max": 10000, "quota_remaining": 9983, "page": 1, "page_size": 30, "total": 44464, "type": "tag"

Title: Deleted comments leave badge on iOS app
Body:
When someone leaves a comment that involves you being notified, you get the notification both on the main toolbar on Stack Exchange and as a notification/badge on the iOS app.

If you read a comment on the website and cause the notification to be removed from the toolbar, the badge also gets removed from the iOS app.

However, when a comment that has previously caused a notification/badge to appear on iOS gets deleted, the badge remains on the iOS app while the notification gets removed from the website toolbar. Could the badge also be removed from the iOS app in this situation?

Title: To what extent is SE usable with console browser, not supporting javascript and images?
Body:
To what extent is SE usable with console browser, not supporting javascript and images? Say lynx/links/links2/elinks or something else?

I can live with javascript killed, but on some occasions when posting an answer captcha pops up and this bugs me, since answering is important.

Title: Rename "view close votes" to reflect what it actually means
Body:
The privilege "view close votes" is very confusingly named. It's not actually about viewing much of anything, since any votes you can view are only as a side effect of being able to cast votes, and it only applies to your own questions, which is not in the name at all. What's more, arguably the most important aspect of it is the ability to cast reopen votes on your own questions, which is also not in the name.

Instead, let's call it something like "[cast] self-close and self-reopen votes". This is sufficiently evocative that someone who knows vaguely what that refers to will remember it. And it's sufficiently unambiguous that anyone who doesn't know what it refers to will know they have no idea what it means and need to go look it up — in contrast to the current one, which seems clear but is actually quite misleading. Finally, this is also not much longer than the current privilege names, so it should probably fit into the table with just a bit of squeezing.

Title: How is newsletter content chosen?
Body:
A site's weekly newsletter includes three standard sections: top new questions, greatest hits, and unanswered. How are the questions for each section chosen?

I can imagine that "top new questions" might be based on hotness, "greatest hits" might be random within a set of questions that meet some unknown-to-me threshold, and "unanswered" might use the same algorithm as the community bump on the main page. But that's all guess-work, and I know I've seen newsletters sometimes that have left me scratching my head.

I vaguely recall seeing a meta post that explained how the newsletter content is chosen, but I couldn't find it in the newsletter tag here on MSE or by searching. So maybe it was on a per-site meta, but if so I don't know which.

Title: Which tags are automatically added to per-site metas?
Body:
The four necessary tags (discussion, feature-request, bug, support), plus the various moderator-only tags (featured, faq, status-completed et al), are presumably automatically included as tags on every per-site meta and not subject to the "automatic deletion of unused tags" algorithm.

I've noticed that other tags also seem to be given this special treatment. Some of the tags on meta.SFF have 0 questions to their name yet haven't disappeared, such as openid and login. I assume the same is true for often-used tags such as scope and tags.

What's the complete list of tags which are automatic on per-site metas?

Title: SEDE - is there a helper table with date records
Body:
I created several queries and needed some records with dates to join against.

For example:

CREATE TABLE #YearQuarter (Y int, 
    ,MonthStart smalldatetime NULL
    ,MonthEnd smalldatetime NULL
    , YqName nvarchar(7) COLLATE SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CS_AS);

INSERT INTO #YearQuarter (Y, MonthStart, MonthEnd, YqName) VALUES 
  (2014, '2014-01-01 00:00:00', '2014-01-31 23:59:59'), 
  (2014, '2014-02-01 00:00:00', '2014-01-28 23:59:59'), -- leap year?!
   ...
  (2016, '2016-01-01 00:00:00', '2014-03-31 23:59:59'), 
   ...
  (2026, '2014-01-01 00:00:00', '2014-01-31 23:59:59') 
;

Since this is cumbersome, error prone (leap years) and does not contain a lot of dates i wonder if there is a helper-table with dates (days, weeks, months, years) for the the last and next 10 years so it can be used to join against.

Title: Can we kill the unicorn?
Body:
Yeah yeah I know we shouldn't kill the Unicorn, and I've tried blasting him with the gun way more than I'm willing to admit, but... is there a way to kill the unicorn who tries to kill us?

Apart of blasting with the gun I tried to jump on him, and sadly can't think of other ways.

If possible somehow, will we get any reputation for killing him, or more likely suffer a reputation penalty for doing such a horrible thing? :)

Title: Issue Using the Chat
Body:
I have 23 rep on superuser but when I click on a chatroom it is still saying I do not have enough rep.

Is it a bug or something? I have emailed superuser support but there has been no response, I emailed stack exchange support - again no response.

Title: Can we see the SE leaderboards for Unikong
Body:
It is kinda sad looking at the leaderboards and seeing it is just you and some preset high scores. I would like to see a real highscore board: with every person per site/the entire network with their score and rank seen by practically anyone. This would encourage more competition and make the game not against the preset high scores, but against everyone.

So can we have an Stack Exchange wide scoreboard for Unikong? If that board is too big: limit to like top 1000 scores or allow a per site wide scoreboard.

Body:
In Unikong, if you enter the Konami code, instead of the normal in-game music you get to listen to a chiptune version of Rick Astley's hit song, "Never Gonna Give You Up".

Is there a place where we can download this song or will StackExchange make it publicly available?

Pretty please?

Title: What's up with the all the users whose names start with "user"?
Body:
Why are there so many user names like user123456?

Is that really their name, or just the name that I'm allowed to see?

I don't believe that so many people chose such a uniform name because they wanted to have a generic name.

Previously I assumed that these were users who deleted their profiles or perhaps died or were imported from another site, but there are certainly a lot of examples of users with great activity and recent activity.

So, where do they come from?

Title: What is the difference of closing for duplicate and flagging for duplicate?
Body: When I encounter a duplicate, I have two choices: Vote closing because it is a duplicate, or flag it as a duplicate. What is the difference and should I do both?

Title: Show post(s) already chosen as duplicate suggestions in iOS app
Body:
When closing a question in the iOS app as duplicate, the UI is very challenging. I understand this is not exactly an easy UI to do given the limitations, but still, it's very complex.

One of the worst experiences, though, is when you're voting to close a question that's already been voted for as duplicate by someone else's vote. You have to get the duplicate's URL and copy it, and then paste it - there's no automatic link. When I'm in the app, I usually find cases where I see an obvious duplicate from comments - I'm not doing tons of research, I only vote where it is obvious.

When there's a close vote as duplicate already pending, please give either a list of already chosen URLs, or something similar. Even if it's only possible when there's only one selection - this would be far better than zero, where you then have to go back to the post, copy the link from comments, and vote again.

Title: Who started a chat room?
Body:
I'm assuming that the author of the first message of a chat room transcript was the one who established a chat room.

If I'm wrong, how else can I find out who first established a chat room such as Lounge<C++>?

Title: Cache (or otherwise speed up) /admin/users
Body:
When I load /admin/users on SO, I generally get a muffin or something while waiting:

Those first two XHR requests (to load the all-time users-with-flagged-posts list and the 30 day one, respectively) take a combined 15-ish seconds, dwarfing all the other requests. Because of how the page is organized, I have to wait for the server to render both users-with-flags lists before anything else.

I have never once used the users-with-flags list. When I go to /admin/users, it's always to get information about recent messages, annotations, etc. I don't want to have to wait fifteen seconds to get that information.

Those lists change at a snail's pace. Can they be aggressively cached, or perhaps relegated to their own item in /admin/links?

Title: Why am I getting logged out of all SE sites?
Body:
I haven't been able to track it down, but it seems that every week or so I get logged out of all SE sites - Ask Ubuntu, Super User, Stack Overflow, all of em.

What's causing this, and how can I fix it? I don't like having to go through the whole login ritual.

Title: Can I ask that someone reviews my edits
Body:
I have enough reputation that my edits are immediately applied. Sometimes I still feel that they should be peer reviewed, just because I'm not completely sure that my edit was correct. On these situations just leaving a comment isn't usually an appropriate solution, because edits are so major that just leaving comment won't get the problem solved.

Can I somehow ask my edits to get peer reviewed?

If not, could this feature be added?

Note: While that situation is fairly common in codegolf.SE, I'm not really sure if that happens on other sites.

Title: Show some indication that comments are loading
Body:
Today I suddenly suffered from a very slow internet connection.

When clicking the "show more comments" link, nothing happened:

I clicked once, twice, nothing happened at all, and I had no way to know something happens behind the scenes. Only after half a minute or so, the comments (one comment in this case) were loaded.

Can we please get some visual indication that the click "worked" and comments are loading? e.g.

  • Add animated GIF next to the link
  • Disable the link while it's loading

Title: Questions relating to homework?
Body: It seems a decent amount of questions are directly related to homework or job interview problems. (E.g. almost anything having to do with the Fibonacci sequence.) Is there a policy on these? Is there a specific flag that could be applied to them? Is this an issue that concerns the SE community? While I enjoy being helpful, I get a weird feeling when answering a question that I suspect will be turned in as school work.

Title: Should numbered lists be required to be sequential?
Body:
Is there a way to override the Numbered List Tool's need to make numbers sequential?

There are times that I really appreciate the fact that it's smart enough to make the numbers sequential regardless of what I type... and then, occasionally in answers, sometimes I want to refer to something in the question using the list format but only want to mention two or three of the points being discussed that aren't necessarily sequential which requires not using the list tool at all.

As an example, on ELL, a user asks a question about the use of a phrase, they list four options:

  1. Option 1
  2. Option 2
  3. Option 3
  4. Option 4

In my response, I might say that Options 2 and 4 are fine but that Options 1 and 3 should be changed as follows:

  1. Option1!

  2. Option3?

Unfortunately, even though I'm talking about Option 3, the system has overridden the "3." that I typed and has converted it to "2.".

So, there are two parts to this question...

  1. is there a way to override the tool's OCD need to make the numbers sequential and

  2. if not, is this the behavior we want?

Is there a third way that allows both the magic of the simple n+1 sequence and the freedom to override the computer that thinks it knows better than I what I want?

Also...

  1. I know that if I put non-list text between the list items, that's a work-around but it's not really the solution I'm interested in.

Body:
As you can clearly see from the screenshot here below, the Ampersand char "&" is not correctly escaped in e-mail digest. The screenshot comes from the daily update I receive from the "dnd-5e" feed of RPG.stackexchange.com .

(Of course we have the same problem with the Non-breaking space)

Title: What's up with the scraper sites?
Body: I've come across all kinds of sites that are just scraping SE sites and taking the info for themselves, usually with a crappy UI. The most recent I've come across is http://earthwithsun.com/, which seems to be scraping SU. Are we doing anything about them? Do we even care?

Title: In-site end-form links don't trigger linked question
Body:
If I want to link to question post #10 on the current site, I can link in either of these two ways:

[Link text](http://meta.stackexchange.com/q/10)

[Link text](/q/10)

The problem is, the latter kind aren't being picked up in the "linked questions" section. Let's fix that.

To prove it, here's a short-form link to question 1234. (Please don't post other links between that question and this one.)

Title: StackExchange oauth login redirection duplicates state and return 404
Body:
We are integrating StackExchange with OAuth. And authenticating user by redirecting to URL like:

https://stackexchange.com/oauth?client_id=542&redirect_uri=https%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A44301%2Fsignin-stackexchange&scope=no_expiry&

This request was 302 redirected to:

/oauth?client_id=542&redirect_uri=https%3a%2f%2flocalhost%3a44301%2fsignin-stackexchange&scope=no_expiry&response_type=&&returnurl=%2foauth%3fclient_id%3d542%26redirect_uri%3dhttps%253a%252f%252flocalhost%253a44301%252fsignin-stackexchange%26scope%3dno_expiry%26response_type%3d%26state%

Then it will return a 404 error.

There is a constant repro in incognito mode (user not login)

We could get around this problem by shorting our state string. But you can see the 302 redirection duplicates all the query parameters. It should not be necessary. And why a 404 was returned for too long URL?

Title: Comment-flag options have gotten much more compact; could we have a little more breathing room?
Body:
Flagging a comment produces the following initial interface (multiple sites, and confirmed with other users):

Before today the options weren't quite so cozy; a couple times I've had to take more than one try at getting the right one, and I haven't even tried on my tablet yet (where my fingers are bigger than a mouse cursor). Could we possibly spread these out a bit more?

You might also notice the absence of the button, which becomes available only after selecting an option. I think it used to be present but grayed out. If this isn't part of a broader redesign where we don't show buttons at all until they're active, you might want to change that too.

I have the same problem as link.

followed by a brief explanation of the question that was linked.

Naturally, I would flag such question, but that duplicate question does not have any answer.

Should I flag the post, or is this tolerated?

What is the best site to ask this question?

I was thinking SuperUser or StackOverflow, but I'm unsure.

Title: Disable all expandable usercards when offline
Body:
When I’m offline, hovering over an expandable usercard has no effect — the data can’t be loaded. I am suggesting that the shadow of the usercard disappear on an offline event, and appear on the online event:

JS: 

$(window).on('online', function() {
  $('body').removeClass('offline');
}).on('offline', function() {
  $('body').addClass('offline');
});

CSS: 

body:not(.offline) .user-info.user-hover .user-gravatar32,
body:not(.offline) .user-info.user-hover .user-gravatar48 {
     -moz-box-shadow: 2px 2px 4px rgba(0,0,0,0.5);
  -webkit-box-shadow: 2px 2px 4px rgba(0,0,0,0.5);
          box-shadow: 2px 2px 4px rgba(0,0,0,0.5);
  filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.Shadow(direction=135,strength=3, color=#808080);
}
.user-info.user-hover .user-gravatar32,
.user-info.user-hover .user-gravatar48
  border-collapse:separate;
  -webkit-transition: box-shadow 1s;
          transition: box-shadow 1s;
 }

Title: Is "About me" portion of my profile licensed under CC BY-SA 3.0?
Body:
I recently read this comment, which is quoted below (without its inline links):

@Robotnik, here's your profile page, which contains information that you, as a user of the Stack Exchange service, have contributed. At the bottom of that page, you will find the text "user contributions licensed under cc by-sa 3.0 with attribution required". – sampablokuper Apr 5 at 17:36

The notification does appear at the bottom of profile pages, as indicated by this comment. However, I don't see any elaboration anywhere (in legalese or otherwise) on the definition of "user contributions" in this context.

Is profile info indeed licensed under CC BY-SA 3.0?

I'm unable to find any other discussions of this aspect of licensing; all the discussions I can find relate to questions, answers, and code—not profiles.

Could someone clarify this, please?

Title: Give a warning to users on retagging sprees
Body:
The edit review queue on Stack Overflow (and possibly other sites) is regularly filled up by users on retagging sprees.

Retagging is not necessarily bad, but retagging sprees are a bit of a problem.
Sometimes, it's a user trying to gain lots of rep the cheap way. Other times, it's users who genuinely believe they are doing the right thing... only to be called out on Meta, and finding out that people have denounced their actions behind their backs.
Meanwhile, the reviewers burn through review slots that are also needed to judge more involved edits.
Also, retagging bumps questions to the front page, flooding it and drowning out newer questions.

My suggestion is that if a user suggests several edits (say 3 edits within 5 minutes) that consist only of the same retag, a warning is given. Not unlike the warning users get after an edit has been rejected.

The warning could, for example, read:

You've been making edits that consist only of changing tags. Before you continue, make sure that there is consensus on [link to per-site meta] that these retags are needed.

Title: Viewing deleted posts in the iOS app
Body:
(I suspect this has been asked before, but I can't find it right now, so I look forward to dupe suggestions.)

On some SE sites, I have privileges to view deleted questions and answers. In the iOS app, some of these posts (particularly comments on them) show up in my Feed. Yet when I click them, I get a blank screen and an error dialog — effectively a 404.

Since I'm authenticated in the app, shouldn't my auth token be enough for the server to allow fetching these posts' content?

Title: Site-specific MathJax affects all sites' question titles in front page hot network questions list
Body:
I noticed while browsing Worldbuilding's front page that the hot network questions list seems to use Mathjax globally for question titles, even when the site the question is from doesn't use Mathjax, leading to unexpected results.

See for example the Server Fault question here:

The real title of that particular question is Get-ADGroupMember $Group fails when $Group contains principals from other domains.

Hence:

  • Question titles from sites that do not have Mathjax enabled should not be rendered using Mathjax, even if the site the list is being rendered on/for has Mathjax enabled.
  • Questions from sites that do have Mathjax enabled should have their titles rendered using Mathjax, ideally regardless of whether the site the list is being rendered on/for has Mathjax enabled or not but at least on sites where Mathjax is enabled.

Title: KBD tags around images are borked
Body: The red area, when surrounded by a KBD tag pushes out of the question area.

Title: Appropriate Response to a User Contacting you via Facebook
Body:
Last night, I answered a question on StackOverflow. I then went to sleep and was planning to edit the question later this morning, since the OP refined their post to make their intentions more clear. However, I had received a follow request and a message in my "Invite Box" on Facebook to answer the question, in addition to a notification I had received from the Stack Exchange site. Said user had found my personal Facebook profile and requested that I update an answer to my question.

StackOverflow disables users from sending unsolicited chat notifications to avoid problems similar to this, and I would preferrably like to be contacted via the comment notification, I was wondering how I should respond to this. Should I delete my answer since it is no longer relevant and avoid answering the question? Should I update my answer to the proper solution? It makes no sense to flag the post, especially given that the message in question occurred outside of the StackOverflow network.

Body: My questions get downvoted until someone formats it into the required format. For example, if I use an exponent as a^b, people edit it out to its correct form. On looking closer, I found that they use characters such as '$' and '/' to get better looking outputs. I'm sorry if this is a beginner's question, I just really want to learn how to obtain these outputs. The same applies to the comments section, where some of my comments look prehistoric due to lack of formatting.

Body:

I would assume it would be something like this:

However, there is no answers parameter in the schema.
How can I do this?

Title: Why can't I sign in to Area51 automatically?
Body:
If I sign in to just one SE community, I'm automatically signed in to all other SE communities that I'm a member of. But this doesn't happen when I visit Area51.

There, I have to sign in separately, although I'm already online on other communities. Why is that?

Title: Duplicate message may incite making more duplicates
Body:
I were stumbling through a question that was marked as a duplicate when I saw this warning and though it did not make much sense:

This question has been asked before and already has an answer. If those answers do not fully address your question, please ask a new question.

It did not explain the person had to explain why none of the answers in the duplicated questions could address the reason. Also it simply incited the 2nd person to make another duplicate!

It should instead be changed to:

This question has been asked before and already has an answer. If those answers do not fully address your question, please ask a new question that describes why the duplicated questions does not solve the issue (or, if the reason isn't clear, just the fact).

Title: Is it intentional that profile website links aren't nofollowed?
Body:
Pretty much exactly as the title says, the website link you can put into your profile isn't rel='nofollow'ed.

Is this intentional, or should this be fixed?

Title: No-longer-valid comments that were responded to
Body: Sometimes I put a comment on a post for a problem that is then fixed and the OP gives a comment to tell me so. It seems strange to delete the comment and leave his comment hanging there, but since my comment is no longer applicable, shouldn't it go? Is there something else I should do?

Title: How frequently does the 'Multiple Closed Question' flag get raised per person?
Body:
If a user posts several questions that get closed off it will trigger a 'Multiple closed question' flag that then gets reviewed by moderators. If the moderator chooses to let it slide and accept the flag with no action, when will that same flag get re-raised?

  • the very next closed question they ask?
  • if they start asking decent questions but then one more gets closed?
  • after 3 years of inactivity they post a question and it gets closed?

How can we keep track if a user is constantly getting their questions closed off? Does accepting the flag reset their behaviour back to zero, requiring a whole new batch of questions be closed in order to re-trigger that flag, or will the flag constantly get raised each time they ask a question that gets closed? (I would hope it's closer to the latter than the former).

My concern is that if I accept a MCQ flag and do nothing with it (perhaps because the user is new and is finding their feet, getting better but still not quite 'there' yet) that they could keep asking poor questions and I wouldn't know about it because I dismissed the first flag and no subsequent flags were raised until they've been posting significantly more poor-quality posts.

Title: Is there a way to draw trees/graphs with MathJax?
Body: I know you can do some basic LaTeX on SE sites using MathJax. Is it possible to draw graphs (as in nodes & edges) or trees through tikz or something similar? Most of the examples I've seen are images.

Title: Is there a way to automatically get an e-mail notification about answers on all of my questions?

It would be preferable to have an automatic way to enable e-mail notifications on all of my questions, but I would be ok with enabling it manually on new questions. I just can't find that feature on the site.

Where can I enable this feature?

If you are answering, please put the classes in a number list

Title: Posting article/tutorial on StackOverflow

I am struggling with creating ASP.NET MVC 6 app with Angular2. There are blog posts about this, but they don't cover latest Angular2 RC release, which changed things a bit. I have it almost figured out, so I thought of sharing my knowledge. I do not own a blog and there is no point in starting one since I don't know when I'll have something else to share with the community. Do you think it would be ok to write an article explaining in details how to setup ASP .NET MVC 6 project with Angular2 RC on StackOverflow?

Title: Is it possible to use the search API to lookup many tags at the same time?
Body:
I am currently using

https://api.stackexchange.com/2.2/search/advanced?order=desc&site=stackoverflow&accepted=False&sort=activity&tagged=MY_TAG in order to query all unanswered questions marked with MY_TAG.

Is it possible to do the same thing with multiple tags at the same time? From my understanding the API allows you to find questions that have all the tags specified at the same time by just separating them with ; (or a logical AND if you may). I would to like to find questions that might contain at least one of the specified tags (a logical OR)

Would I have to perform multiple queries in order to get what I need?

Title: Where should I ask for recommendation on (possibly) existing programming plugins?
Body: I'm looking into developing an ordering app for a potential client. The main part that I'm concerned about in this question is the payment mechanism. I would assume that there are already multiple plugins or similar programs out there, but I'm not sure where (or if) I should be asking for recommendations.

Title: Why do some technologies have their own StackExchange?
Body: Unix. LaTeX. Salesforce. Magento. The Stack Exchange API. These are all developer-oriented technologies...yet questions about them are best asked on their dedicated Stack Exchange sites. What is it with these (and other) developer-oriented technologies that warrant their own Stack Exchange?

Title: What happens to a serial downvoter?
Body:
Last week sometime someone started to go through my posts on a particular Stack Exchange site and downvoted them, about 5 old posts of mine.

The system automatically reversed these downvotes so my rep is back where it should be.

What happens to the person who did these downvotes, assuming it was all one person?

Do they get a penalty or something for vote fraud?

Title: Prevent chat from scrolling while I'm mousing over controls
Body:
At the first chat meta tavern town hall thing, there were a lot of people in one room. This exposed a problem with the way chat works: when the messages are scrolling very fast, it's very hard indeed to reply to messages.

Is there the possiblity that chat could not scroll when there's a new message if I'm moused over .meta or .action-link?

Title: Use a comment as a reason for an edit
Body:
One of the purposes of comments is to provide feedback on a post, and this request is specific to the comments that are feedback on ways to improve the post.

When an edit is being made to a post, the editor could select a comment, and have it be linked to that edit. Maybe have it be the edit summary, maybe have it linked via a new method. This linkage would be used to document that the edit is taking care of the improvement requested in the comment.

Once the edit is complete, this should then remove the comment (and possibly comments replying to it), closing the loop on the comment improving the post. It would also provide a new way for comment threads to be cleaned up.

Title: Viewing the exact timestamp of a question on Stack Exchange
Body: Is there any way to view the exact timestamp of a question asked on Stack Exchange? (ideally second precision)

Title: Protect my account from deletion
Body:
I was pondering over How to protect my account from being deleted intentionally by someone having access to the pc that I am logged in?

Premise: I am always logged in on my stackoverflow account on my work PC, and I was considering the possibility of someone from my work deleting my account in my absence, for all nefarious reasons and due to the fact the local pc user account passwords are the same for all of us, due to some policy. :(

I also don't want to go through the hassle of logging in and logging out of SO every time I use the PC.

So my question is what all measure are put in place to protect my SO/SE account, which I value the most among my online presences , because I see my time/effort spent on SO contributions as an investment.

Something along the lines of ...

  • 2 factor authentication before deletion.
  • An Easy way to Undelete and Retrieve the whole account with its rep and activity etc.
  • Asking to login again to the openID/Google Account account before deletion.

Title: Edit tag wiki except character count is incorrect and leads to inconsistent error message
Body:
When editing a tag except, the displayed "characters left" disagrees with the character count used by the error message:

As you can see from the screen shot, the "characters left" indicates that the text length is within limit, but the error message indicates the text length is too long by 3 characters.

Experimentation lead me to conclude that new line chars are not counted by the "characters left" indicator, but are counted by the code that generates the error message.

To reproduce, use this text (not including the final new line):

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. 
Etiam fringilla, ipsum eget facilisis tristique, est arcu convallis sem, vitae volutpat lectus lectus eu neque.
Aenean porttitor, diam in gravida finibus, massa sapien egestas leo, eu aliquet nisi felis ut velit.
Curabitur condimentum dui congue dolor ornare, sed semper risus tristique. Phasellus eros ligula, vehicula vitae sapien ut, lobortis aliquam ante. Sed accumsan vestibulum tempus. Cras aliquet

Title: Add migration path to Mother Meta for per-site metas
Body:
There are multiple questions, feature-requests specifically, on per-site metas that affect the whole network. Migrating these questions here would make it seen by a larger community, likely bring it to the attention to the powers that be, and allow it to be answered in a broader sense.

My proposal: Just as every site has a default migration path to its per-site meta, every per-site meta should have a default migration path to Mother Meta, AKA Meta.SE.

Title: What is the best practice template for textifying a link not in the middle of a sentence?
Body:
I often find myself replacing plain text links in the middle of articles to make them more readable. For example some markdown might have an answer about bespin and added a link at the end or in the middle.
Example:

lorum bespin good etc.

http://starwars.wikia.com/wiki/Bespin

What is the ideal way to textify a link in this case? I looked at some citation information and the best I can come up with is the following template: 

"[Bespin](http://starwars.wikia.com/wiki/Bespin)", *wikia.com*

"[<Page_Title>](<link>)", *<website_domain>*

But I'm not sure if that's ideal, perhaps it would look better without the quotes, or there is some other preferred style.

What is the best practice format for textifying a floating link reference?

Title: How did I get into the private beta without commiting?
Body:
Yesterday, the the DeepWeb.SE proposal went into private beta. I knew this because I got the following notification:

private beta invitation This proposal has entered private beta. Click here to join.

So I visited the site, created my account there and started participating. However, I had not commited to the site or followed the proposal on area51. As you can see in my area51 profile, the Deep Web proposal doesn't show up in the Current Commitment or the Followed section.

According to all sources on the topic I found around here, the only way to access a private beta is having commited to the site prior to the beta or receiving an invitation from a commited member. I don't know any of the active participants of the Deep Web private beta, and I didn't get an invitation email either, but only the notification. So I doubt someone personally invited me.

So how did I get into that private beta?

Title: Don't allow user to use their dupehammer to reopen their own question

It seems to me that you shouldn't be able to reopen your own question with a dupehammer.

Title: Why isn't the up/downvote ratio visible to everyone when the information is available anyway?
Body:
Low rep users can't see how many downvotes/upvotes a question or answer got, they can only see the total score.

Except they actually can. They can go to the poster's profile, click the reputation tab, and see downvotes and upvotes there.

This is a rather inconvenient and boring way to do it, but the information is available.

So if the information is available anyway, why not:

1. Give low-rep users the ability to see the ratio.

or

2. Prevent low-rep users from seeing the downvotes in the reputation tab of the profile.

If one of these was implemented, the system would be consistent.

Why is this information hidden from low-rep users on the question itself, but available if they go to the poster's profile?

Title: Average answer count per question and comment count per question by week
Body:
I am trying to gather information on the number of answers per question by week for a user with fewer than 25 reputation points from the math.stackexchange site (and the comment count per question).

I have the following query but it has not worked

-- CTE with year, week and start of week dates
with yw as (
select distinct 
   year(creationdate) as y 
 , datepart(week, creationdate) as w
 -- http://stackoverflow.com/a/3936891/578411
 , cast(
     DATEADD(
          day, 
          1 - DATEPART(dw, creationdate), 
          creationdate) 
      as date
    ) as sdow
from posts
)

-- grouping over the union
select sdow
 , avg(answercount) as [answercount]
from 
(
--answercount from users with reputation < 25
select sdow
   , count(*) as [answercount]
from posts p
inner join users u on u.id = p.owneruserid
right outer join yw 
 on yw.y = year(p.creationdate) 
and yw.w = datepart(week, p.creationdate) 
where u.reputation < 25 -- rep
group by sdow
union
) as total

Title: Fallback jQuery Reference when Google APIs inaccessible
Body:
Stack Exchange relies on jQuery to provide some essential functionalities, such as Log In.

Currently, the reference is to Google APIs.

<script src="//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.7.1/jquery.min.js"></script>

Although the availability of Google APIs is high, the accessibility may vary between different areas in the world.

I suggest add a secondary reference, such as the reference from Microsoft, when Google APIs is not accessible.

The issue turns out to be more severe. If I want to log in to Stack Exchange, I have to go to my office.

Title: Is it acceptable to reopen a closed question solely for the purpose of answering it?
Body:
I'm a regular user of the Deep Web, which is currently in private beta. We as a community had reached a consensus that a certain kind of question was off-topic on the site and should be migrated, so we closed one such question. Later, a high-rep user on the site commented on the closed question:

The question must be migrated, but I can answer, so reopen it please

Generally, I thought the rule was to not answer closed questions as this sets a bad example for future visitors to the site. I replied

This is something that I've noticed in many of your answers. When you know a question is blatantly off-topic (like this one), please don't reopen it to answer it. This only encourages more off-topic questions. As for this question, I agree with @JohnSmith that this question is more suited to Tor.SE. As such, I've voted to leave this question closed.

to which this user replied

I see no problem in answering a question if I know an answer. Yes, the question itself seems to be more fot Tor.SE - but no migration is done AFAIK, and - after all - it's a Question and Answer network, right&

I personally thought that this was not an acceptable course of action to take. Is voting to reopen a question just so you can answer it acceptable? (Also, what should I do in this situation?)

Title: Answered question is identical to mine, but accepted solution doesn't work for me
Body:
Here is the situation. I have a problem, and upon searching for a solution, I find that another SO user has already posted a question and accepted and answer. However, while the question perfectly describes my issue, the answer does not solve my problem.

What is the best practice in this situation? If I post a new question, it will surely get marked as duplicate, and rightfully so. If I ask follow up questions in the comments, I am potentially creating a cluttered, unhelpful comment section. I can upvote the question, but even if this gets more attention for the question, there is no reason for another user to try to answer the question, because the OP already has an answer he or she is satisfied with.

It seems like this is a situation that would arise fairly often because an accepted answer is not accurate or because there are subtle differences in the problem. As someone with a better answer, I can post that and get upvoted past the accepted answer. But as someone with the same question, do I have any recourse to get help from the community to find an answer that works for me, without posting a duplicate question?

I opened the questions, and it turns out that the questions whose votes round to 10k or more show up in the search results with 1/10 the number of votes. That "1.5k" question is actually 15k.

Title: Define a consistent visual style that identifies mod-only information and controls
Body:
As a mod, you can sometimes forget, or just don't even know what parts of the UI are displaying privileged, mod-only information. Checking things out with socks, or on other sites where you have 20k rep (at which point all non-mod UI features are unlocked) can be impractical.

A recent example is the stats that are visible on the election page to mods. There are no hints that this information is not public to everyone visiting the page.

A simple solution to this would be a simple style rule that is applied to all mod information. It needn't be much more complex than border: 1px solid red. This would make it completely unambiguous what is a mod tool and what isn't, particularly in lesser-used parts of the UI like elections. It would also help new mods find their feet much more quickly.

Title: Problem With Code: Pulling Information from All Questions in a Day
Body:
I have the following code that I adapted from another person's code for my specific purpose of reputation statistics on the math.stackexchange platform.

-- lastNdays: enter an integer "retrieve only post from the lastNdays"

declare @lastNdays int
set @lastNdays = ##lastNdays:int?10##

select *
from Posts p
inner join users u on u.id = p.owneruserid
where 
p.PosttypeId=1
and p.CreationDate >= dateadd(day, -@lastNdays, getdate())
and u.reputation < 250
and u.reputation > 100

order by dateadd(day, -@lastNdays, getdate())

While the code runs fine, there are two problems with the results that I have a problem fixing:

  1. It does not pull data from the last N days in that I get data from 5/29/2016 to bits of 6/5/2016.

  2. While I want to order the data by the day at which the questions were posted, I get some random scatter of dates (probably because of the dates at which the answers were posted)

How can I fix this?

Title: Does each post have its own visibility-time counter?
Body:
According to Reputation and Historical Archives:

if you've contributed something worthwhile to the site, you should keep the reputation for that even if it eventually gets deleted. "Worthwhile" here is defined as,

  • A score of 3 or greater

  • Visible on the site for at least 60 days

How is "visibility on the site" counted?

For example if I:

  1. post a question/answer that gains +3 score on its 1st day
  2. delete it on the 1st day
  3. undelete 59 days later
  4. delete it again on its 65th day since creation

Will it be considered "visible on the site for at least 60 days"?

If I:

  1. post a question/answer that gains +3 score
  2. delete it on its 32nd day since creation
  3. undelete the post 7 days later, modify it (or not) and leave it
  4. delete it again after another 32 days

Will it be considered "visible on the site for at least 60 days"?

Does each post have its own visibility-time counter? Or is it simple time difference between creation and deletion?

Title: Define custom console logging for all Node objects
Body:
Currently, the virtual console defines a custom logging for HTMLElement objects, e.g.

console.log(document.body);

However, not all Element objects are HTMLElement, e.g.

console.log(document.createElementNS('foo', 'bar'));

And not all Node objects are Element neither

console.log(document);

console.log(document.createTextNode('foo'));

Custom logging for these kind of objects would be great!

  • Device Manufacturer: samsung
  • Device Model: SM-T700
    • OS Version: 5.0.2 (T700XXU1BOL1)

Title: What's the policy on cross-posting by different users on two sites?
Body:
I know that there's no rule against the same question appearing on two Stack Exchange sites if it's asked by two different users at different times (there are many sites with non-trivial overlaps, and cross-site duplication is inevitable), and that the same user cross-posting the same question on two sites is frowned upon.

Does it make any difference if the person who posts the question on the second site is aware of the version on the first site (they didn't ask it themselves, but perhaps they answered it or commented on it, or perhaps they just happen to be an active user on the first site)?

For instance, let's say user X posts a question on Arts & Crafts which is almost the same as a previous question by user Y on Woodworking, and user X is perfectly aware of the existence of this pre-existing question, although they didn't ask it themselves.

Would this be considered abuse? Should user X include attribution to user Y's question and/or ask user Y for permission first?

Note: I have not done this myself, nor do I plan to. I'm just wondering what the advised procedure is if this happens.

Title: Can I include a more permissive license for my code contributions in my profile?
Body:
..and will that have any effect?

Currently, I want all of my contributions on StackExchange to be available not just under SE's licensing terms (that goes without saying), but also under a version of "Unless you're preventing other people from using it, fair game" kind of license.

Is that legally somehow possible without rehosting all of my content on say github?

To elaborate: I want people to be able to do anything they want with my code, without attribution, and the only thing they shouldn't be able to do is prevent other people from using my code. That means that I don't need or want credit and that the code can be used as much as anyone desires in any application.

Title: Reviews: should I click No Action Needed, or Skip, when I can't edit?
Body:
When reviewing posts on a site I don't yet have edit privileges on, occasionally I'll come across a post that needs editing, but the 'edit' option is greyed out. My understanding is that this is due to an already pending suggested edit.

In these cases - assuming no other action is required - should I click 'No Action Needed', or 'Skip'?

Title: Should I 'seed' questions, particularly on beta sites, when I don't necessarily have that question myself?
Body:
I've come across this a few times: an opportunity to help 'seed' an SE site (particularly a beta site) by asking a question that seems to be a good question, but isn't asked yet on the site.

It might be something I thought of and briefly wondered about, but apart from that isn't a "real problem or question I have encountered".

Given that SE sites are about building a repository of great content, should I ask still ask my question?

Or, given I could be wasting someone's time responding when the answer isn't actually going to help me, should I refrain?

I ask particularly about beta sites because I know it's important to build great content during the beta phase, but I am also interested in the applicability of this to graduated sites too (and no, this isn't a seed question itself - I've encountered this conundrum several times!)

Title: Comments on iOS app sorted from newest to oldest
Body:
I was reading the comment as usual, then there is a new comment. The app reloaded, and huh, it sorted the comments reversely.

  • App Version: 1.4.2.2
  • Device: iPad 2 (GSM)
  • OS Version: Version 9.3.2 (Build 13F69)

Title: Close the notification panel when not necessary in iOS app
Body:
When I open a notification and start thinking for a comment or an answer, I want to focus to it and wish the notification panel disappears for a second. I suggest you to:

  • automatically hide it when it tap on an notification
  • or have a button to let me hide it myself

What do you think?

Title: Where to ask about branding?
Body:
For example, I want to create a website with the name Stack Overfailed. However, since it's fresh so I guess that a descriptive URL will encourage people to visit more. I'm thinking about using the domain getcodefixed.com for the Stack Overfailed brand name. I want to ask if this is a good approach or not.

Where should I ask this question? I think Webmaster is the closest relevant site for this, since it has the branding tag. However, this question is not about a SEO thing, and that site is a site for technical problem. I'm looking for a site focuses more in marketing aspect.

Title: Bug in Tidy in Snippet
Body:
In simple words, when there's a code like this:

<img src="http://127.0.0.1/wp/wp-content/uploads/2016/06/PreviousArrowsLikeACatPagenJewelryPentagramsSilverWiccanNecklaceBracelet.png" alt="PreviousArrowsLikeACatPagenJewelryPentagramsSilverWiccanNecklaceBracelet" width="50" height="50" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-161" />

The Stack Snippet Tidy feature makes it this way:

<img src="http://127.0.0.1/wp/wp-content/uploads/2016/06/PreviousArrowsLikeACatPagenJewelryPentagramsSilverWiccanNecklaceBracelet.png" alt="PreviousArrowsLikeACatPagenJewelryPentagramsSilverWiccanNecklaceBracelet" width="50" height="50" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-161"
/>

The bug is that, it should not bring down the /> making it to the next line. I have taken the exact specimen to demonstrate. It is still unclear that it is a margin (maximum columns or characters in a line) limitation or it is a bug.

Title: Click to open any stack, even if I have no profile
Body:
In the Android app feed, there is a confusing difference in behavior between questions in stacks where I have an active profile and ones I don't. Clicking on the site icon of sites with profile (green freehand circles) will open the list of questions, while ones where I don't (red) won't.

Is there a reason for this difference? Us there a reason not to support click-to-open for all sites? I know that occasionally, when I see an interesting question on a stack I don't follow, I like to go in and read more. Right now, it involves pulling the sidebar, clicking All Sites and searching for the stack in the whole list, instead of just clicking it.

Title: Rep from closed sites appears in the Area 51 total but not the combined flair
Body:
My usercard on Area 51 (the kind that contains my total SE rep and the sites I'm active on) shows a combined reputation (18,234) that is noticeably more than the sum of the reputation I have on each site shown (16,852). The difference is exactly equal to the rep I had on the now closed Deep Web site. It's been several weeks since the site's closure, so caching probably isn't the issue. I have more than 200 rep on Area 51, so it's counted in the image flair.

The correct, lower combined rep figure appears in chat and on my flair image. The only place I've found with the higher figure is the Area 51 usercard. Is that intended?

Title: Achievements dropdown and profile don't agree on rep change from removed user
Body:
I happened to notice this in the rep-change dropdown list:

This is the only "user removed" event shown here on that site on that day. (You'll just have to trust me on that; the whole list of events for the day doesn't fit in the container.) However, look at this from the reputation tab of my profile:

Both agree on the total rep change for the day; it's just that one shows -5 and the other shows -10 for a removed user. I wasn't paying enough attention to know which is the real change.

I'm not bothered by the event (these things happen; no sense trying to figure out the details, and anyway it's only 5 or 10 rep). But I don't think I've seen a mismatch like this before, and the hobgoblin of little minds demanded that I report this apparent bug.

Title: Does closing a question on Meta cast an automatic downvote?
Body:
I just closed three questions on Meta as off-topic, and at all three questions immediately got another downvote. Does closing a question on Meta cast an automatic downvote?

If so, when was this implemented? Also, was is implemented for other sites?

I know this used to happen, but I thought it was disabled.

Title: Moderator Flag Annotation
Body:
Flags are a great system for addressing issues in content, however sometimes the solution to a flag is not cut and dry. They may require discussion with other moderators or time to gather input from the community before a proper decision can be reached on the flag.

Currently, chat is available for discussing issues with other moderators, but there is no way to make notations on a flag itself about its state. Adding an ability to annotate a flag would aid moderators in coordinating when either discussion is needed or other steps that don't resolve the flag directly need to be taken. It would also offer a better audit record of the reasoning behind moderator actions for any situations where a user is upset about an action.

As a specific example of where this would be useful, one of the communities I moderate recently had a flag for a post that was labeled as "off topic". The question itself is certainly highly borderline, but not quite enough for me to close outright without giving the community a chance to take action. We decided to wait and see what the community does and close if it only receives negative attention for a certain period (since the community itself is too small to reliably close borderline questions some of the time). It would be great to be able to make note of this so we remember what is going on with that flag, but currently we just have to rely on all of our memories to keep track.

Title: Prevent user banned on SE site from participating in that site's chat rooms
Body:
We have a case on Arqade where a user who is banned from the main site is still chatting in Arqade chat rooms, because his chat parent account was on a different site at the time of the Arqade site ban, and so wasn't affected by the ban. If his chat parent user was Arqade at the time of the ban, he'd have been banned from participation in all of chat for the duration of the site ban.

Instead of working this way, I think it would be nice if users who are banned from a specific site are also banned from participating in chat rooms specifically tied to that same site. So for example, the above user wouldn't be able to chat in Arqade chat rooms, but would be unaffected in other chat rooms.

I think this is cleaner than the current system of banning or not depending on the parent user at the time of the ban.

Title: Reputation graph only partially filled
Body:
When I view a large selection (12+ months) of my daily reputation graph in my profile under the latest version of Chrome, only portions of the content is shown:
