I tried to navigate to a user's profile from chat room.

But since the number of rooms in which the user is joined is large enough, the link is not visible and the box is not scrollable.

Even if we scroll the window to top, the box stay the same. I think it is because position:fixed

Usually the link to user profile is found above the list of rooms.

This is another user's details from chat.

Title: Add a section in the mod help center about redactions
Body:
The mod-only help center is helpful, especially for new moderators. It contains information that mods need (and a warning not to copy stuff out).

One of the most commonly asked things in the TL is how to redact posts. (1) (2) (3) (4). It's not intuitive at all. So, what could be a better thing to put in the mod help center than something that lots of mods have trouble with?

Title: 'User removed' is counted twice in reputation tab when that user approved edits
Body:
The reputation tab of this user bot's profile is a bit off.

On June 15th, a user was deleted who (presumably) cast the final 'approve' vote on two suggested edits. On that day, SmokeDetector's reputation decreased from 299 to 295, but the reputation tab makes it look like a -8 change.

Title: Why not indicate the username of the OP when they click on "this solved my problem"?
Body:
Why not indicate the username of the OP when they click on "this solved my problem"?

Instead, only "community" is shown. Example.

Title: Where would I post a question about how to do something in programming (without having code in the question)
Body:
I have a question that I would like answered but don't have code involved (because I have not created the application yet). It is essentially how can I do a thing in node.js or can you point me to a resource to learn how I can do this thing.

This is likely a question which would get flagged in stack overflow

Title: How to handle post edits that result in an error on submittal?
Body:
I recently edited a post that contained a large chunk of code. Upon finishing the edit (grammar, spelling, and clarity), I received the following error on submitting the edited post for review:

It looks like your post is mostly code; add some more details.

I suspect the author had just enough to circumvent this error & I wound up abandoning the edit.

Should details be added in order to properly improve a post and save needed edits in cases like this or is it more appropriate to abandon the edit and comment on the post for the author to clarify/edit themselves?

Title: User reference in error message?
Body:
I realize this is particularly nitpicky but I recently edited a post and submitting it resulted in the following error message:

It looks like your post is mostly code; add some more details.

Technically shouldn't it refer to the 'user's post' and/or 'your edit' since it isn't my post?

Title: HNQ link refreshes page
Body:
For a few days now, I've been having a weird problem. I previously thought it my be just my device, as I'm not having similar problems on my desktop machine, but @PhiNotPi managed to reproduce.

Sometimes, when I browse the desktop version of Code Golf and click on one of the links in the Hot Network Questions list, the target URL appears briefly in my browser's address bar, everything flashes, and the browser refreshes the old page. There's no history entry or indication of what happened. To make matters worse, the HNQ list has been rotated by the time the page refreshed, so I'm left without the distraction I asking for.

This is an intermittent bug, as all of this happens only once out of every 10 or 20 HNQ links I click. In case it matters, I'm using Chrome 59.0.3071.125 on Android 6.0.1.

Title: Why are mentions not updated when profile name is changed?
Body:
I observed that when you change your profile name the mentions of your old names are not updated. Why is it so? Shouldn't it be updated as well so that the the comments or answers with mentions would still make sense.

For example A comments on a question :

I agree with OP's point of view, But this is a duplicate question. - A

Then an other user, B says,

Strongly agree with @A - B

Now, @A changes her profile name and makes it @diva

OP comes and read the comments only to be confused over what @B thinks !

Because now the first comment looks like this

I agree with OP's point of view, But this is a duplicate question. - diva

But the second comment is still

Strongly agree with @A - B

Title: Can't delete profile on certain SE sites
Body:
It seems that I can't delete my account from certain SE sites.

I have for many years had several accounts I don't use and am at the moment only active on Physics while I wish to keep a profile on only a few others.

On the user profile pages on the sites, there is a button called Edit Profile & Settings. After clicking the side menu gives several options, one of which is Delete profile... But on some sites this button is just gone.

For example I am unable to delete my account on Music, Serverfault and Lifehacks (this latter one is in beta).

How come that some sites are trying to hang extra much on to me? How do I delete my account on those?

Title: Notification for resolved flags
Body:
Is it possible to get a notification when one of our flags has been resolved? This request is similar to this question, but I think it would be good for all users, not just the first few flags. Aside from many new users not knowing where they can see all of their flags, it gets annoying to go back and check on the status every so often.

I figure one option is just to have a simple notification that says "Your flag has been resolved." Another option is to specify the outcome - "Your recent flag was marked helpful/disputed/declined." and maybe include any moderator messages in the notification. Any of these would be fine, but it would just be nice to be told when a flag rather than having to actively check on the status. This seems like a pretty simple functionality that should be possible.

Title: While undeleting deleted answer, the snippet seems missing
Body:
Yesterday I made an answer to this question Why does width and height affect how a flex item is rendered?. I got some downvotes and so I decided to check am I missed something. I temporarily deleted it for reviewing and then undeleted it.

Then the snippet seems missing.

I set the snippet to hidden by default.

Title: Inner spaces not detected on the client side
Body:
Need of moderator intervention flag requires at least 10 characters to enter for describing a problem. Before you do it Flag button is disabled. But if you enter something with inner spaces, e.g. + test!, button will be enabled:

Pressing on the button closes flag window and shows me an error:

Is it possible to use same check algorithm on client and server side here?

Title: Community specific site icons are not displaying in top of the sites in mobile web view
Body:
In the mobile web view, the community specific icons are not displaying in the top, before the site names except the Stack Overflow.

The Stack Overflow icon is displaying on it's site and for the remaining sites the Stack Exchange icon only displaying.

Screenshot taken from SO and DBA:

  

So the community specific icons which are displaying in the Your Communities menu, can be display in the top of the page, before the site name in the mobile web view too.

Title: Userscript to show author of comment in inbox
Body:
First off, I know this exists, and I used it before. I just can't remember the name off the top of my head.

I want a user script that will show comments (and possibly answers), looking like this:

[Site icon] comment [User name, ex. John Smith]

What is this called, and where do I get it?

Title: Migration stats pages seem to be broken
Body:
I've checked the migration stats pages on the sites I have access to them English Language Learners and Movies & TV and the stats don't reflect the actual migrations at all. It seems to be having trouble attributing the migrations to the sites they came from or were sent to.

Here's the ELL page:

As you can see, there are 190 migrations that apparently come out of thin air (most of them are from ELU). The system is able to correctly attribute a few from ELU and one from French. Similarly, in the away column, the two that were migrated away don't note where they were migrated to. In this case, they were both migrated to ELU.

A few months ago we noticed an odd migration error similar to this that was related to the Meta URL change. I don't think this is related because these questions aren't from Meta to Main site, they are between sites.

Title: Should I accept my own answer on a discussion if no other answers were posted?
Body:
Around three months ago I posted the question Which required tag should be used with [tag:synonym-request]?, looking for feedback on what tags should be used in a synonym-request.

I included my own self-answer suggesting that the discussion tag be used, hoping that my initial answer would help spark more discussion. Unfortunately, after 80 days and 30 views, it seems that there wasn't much interest in the question.

In the absence of other posts, I'm considering setting my suggestion as the accepted answer. However, I'm not sure how I feel about self-accepting my own answer on an open-ended question designed to start a discussion.

Should I self-accept my own answer on a discussion if there aren't any other answers?

Title: Info page for synonym tag not redirected to its base tag page
Body:
Info page for synonym tag [discussion] on ruSO.meta doesn't redirected to its base tag info page [обсуждение].

Related report: Migrated to localized meta site questions have [discussion] tag in English

Title: Spam in About Me Section
Body: If a user has a link to a website such as www.enlarge-your-brest.com (no kidding, I've encountered some) in their About Me Section or the user card, should the moderation be alerted?

Title: Where can I ask questions about the Kronos InTouch?
Body:
I have a question about the Kronos InTouch. Specifically, how many registered employees it can hold before reaching maximum capacity.

(For reference, the Kronos InTouch is a self-service badge reader used by businesses for workforce management and recording employee timestamps)

Would my question be best for Super User, Internet of Things, or some other site?

Note: Stack Overflow has a tag for Kronos Workforce Central, but that is only applicable for programming-related questions.

Title: What phrases can lead to an instant comment deletion when flagged?
Body:
One not-so-well-known hidden feature of Stack Exchange is that, if a comment contains certain phrases, they may be instantly removed after a single flag.

For instance, any comment beginning with +1 can be deleted after a single "Not Constructive" flag.

Is there a list of phrases which, when included in comments, can trigger an instant deletion when flagged?

Title: Are review queues supposed to include answers to my own question?
Body:
While browsing the First Posts review queue on Super User, I came across a familiar looking answer.

I sit there and wonder why this answer might look familiar. I'm fairly certain I've just recently seen it before. Maybe seeing the question's author might remi...

Oh. It's an answer to a question I just asked an hour ago.

Is this intentional? Are we supposed to see answers to our own questions in review queues?

Title: Can a chat bot feed be made for questions tagged with [anime] tag but not if they're also tagged [identification]?
Body:
Stuff has happened, and anime identification requests have flooded the Anime, Movies and SciFi. Anime banned all anime IDs completely, but SciFi and Movies still accept them. Sometimes they get interesting non-identification request questions, but a lot of the time they're IDs and posting them in our chat feed is of no use to anyone.

Is there a way to create an RSS feed with all [anime] questions from Movies, Scifi and Japanese, but filter out the questions which also have any of the [identification] tags?

Title: Should I post about a problem that was solved without knowing how?
Body:
I recently ran into an issue trying to install the LastPass addon for Google Chrome. It gave me an error message I'd never seen before. (Error: Line 1, column 1, Unexpected token). I was able to reproduce the issue 3 separate times.

As I was writing up my issue, I tried to install LastPass again to verify the issue. To my surprise, the addon installed without any issues on the 4th try.

I'm still not sure what caused the error to happen, or why the install worked on the 4th attempt.

Should I still post my question if I don't know what caused the issue or how it was solved?

Title: Is there a glossary for all the acronyms of Stack Exchange sites?
Body:
Maybe this question is a duplicate, but I'm not finding it in my searches.

There are several acronyms in several websites, such as: MMA, MWE, ...

I visit several sites, but as I visit some of these sites infrequently, I do not know what some people are commenting on.

Is there a glossary of this in the Help Center?

Title: Is it right to recommend a book in an answer?
Body:
I have recently written an answer to a question on one of Stack Exchange's sites. In my answer I included a link to a chapter of a book to add more information about the point I was discussing. Between two parentheses I said that this is a link to a chapter from a given book, and recommended the OP to read it.

So, is it right to recommend a book in an answer? Or should I remove this recommendation?

Title: Is it a bad practice to just include the question in the title?
Body:
Occasionally, I come across questions (specifically in Stack Overflow) where the actual question is just included as the title of the post but not in the text. So the text just explains the problem without ever including the question.

Is this a bad practice to include the question just in the title but not in the text? Personally I find it inconvenient, even though I read the title before clicking once I'm on the question I tend to focus on the text.

I will try to include examples of this as I come by them.

Title: Prompt for confirmation when navigating away from stack snippet
Body:
In the following specific case:

  1. Click 'Ask Question'
  2. Click the stack snippet button without entering any other text or question titles or anything in the editor first.

When you navigate away from the page (back button, reload, etc.), you currently are not prompted for confirmation with the "unsaved changes" dialog.

This is a request to trigger the unsaved changes confirmation in this case (in addition to the current behavior where it is displayed when you enter text in the editor).

Authoring a code snippet, even if nothing else is entered yet, does represent unsaved work.

Current workaround if you don't want to get bitten by this (for example if your stupid laptop's stupid keyboard has stupid browser back/forward keys right next to the stupid arrows because really? why? how does that make ANY sense??? ... ahem) is to always enter something, even if it's just temporary gibberish, into the editor before clicking the code snippet button.

Title: What is the purpose of the formatting sandbox?
Body:
I went from the Community user to the Sandbox archive to the Formatting Sandbox.
What is the point of any of these?
I read the formatting sandbox description but you can see how your text will be formatted when you write a question. I only see it being useful to test bugs with the editor.

Title: Accidentally downvoted in an exchange I don't have 125 reputation on
Body: On occasion I will accidentally click the downvote button in an exchange I don't have 125 reputation on. As the pop-up says, nothing public happens, but the downvote is still recorded. Is there a way to "unrecord" the downvote? I've been upvoting then removing my upvote in the hopes an upvote still clears a downvote for sub-125 users, but I have no idea if this is actually working. Do recorded downvotes from sub-125 users even matter?

Title: Why tag [a] is not allowed, but all other letters are allowed
Body:
I just tried to post a question with a Latin alpabet tags, and have been notified that tag a is not allowed. Why it is not allowed?

Despite of allowing any other single letter tag.

Seems this affects all of SE sites.

Title: Make the linked text of post notice clickable on Android app
Body: The text "click here" should be clickable imo.

Title: Intuitive UI for first-posts review - ability to select (checkbox) from all current tags
Body:
Current Behavior

On SO website, the 'Review -> First Posts' interface can be better. Currently, a User has to open the Filters and type in the tags to see the related first posts & then select.

This process has to repeated every time you select/ change a new tag/s.

Proposed Change

In the new interaction - We give an ability to "select or un-select" the tags from the pool instead of typing and then selecting. This action will refresh the underlying first posts catalog.

On the backend side, pool of tags can be calculated by aggregating the tags on each first posts. If the pool happens to be too large, then we can have a way to personalize it for on load filtering.

Value Add

Drive a user to review maximum number of first posts depending on their area of expertise.

Thanks

Title: Hidden Communities don't play well with comment-to-chat migrations
Body:
It's come up quite a few times since Hidden Communities were implemented - users expect privacy and unexpectedly end up losing it all when conversation gets migrated to the chat system. Suddenly their name and network profile are exposed on a message which was once linked to a profile not visibly linked to the rest of the network.

Fixing this in the chat system is unlikely to happen, just because of the way chat exists. You have a single profile which operates for all the sites on our network, minus two. So if you're holding out on being able to participate in a site-specific chat room without linking to the rest of your network activity, don't get your hopes up too high.

However, we can prevent the surprise of suddenly losing anonymity due to no fault of the owner by doing some more pre-processing on the site before the migration of comments to chat actually occurs. A couple of solutions:

Don't migrate messages from users who have the site hidden

Essentially, for each comment under the post look up the owner. If the owner has this site set as hidden, then just delete the comment and don't include it in the list of comments to be migrated into the chat room.

This is the less-than-ideal option because it can effectively destroy a conversation, making the migration to chat somewhat useless. If the entire conversation is between two users and you delete all the messages from one user, then all you're migrating is a one-sided conversation with no context.

Anonymize all messages from users who have the site hidden

Similar to the previous option, we'll need to look at the user. This time if they have the site set as hidden, we simply won't migrate their user data with the comment when it makes it to the new chat room (will show their plain-text display name with no link to their profile).

Assuming there are no major pitfalls with this solution, it'd be ideal because it preserves all messages and has less chance of breaking a conversation while still preventing the user's identity being revealed in chat. But there may be something I'm not thinking of here.

So what am I missing? Anything? Which option would be better for users who utilize the hidden communities feature and why? Or are there other solutions that might work better for this case?

No, we're not adding a site preference so users can choose what happens to their comments in these situations.

Title: What's the process to change a site logo?
Body: Who is responsible for defining a site logo? I mean, there are moderators of the site that define it, or stackexchange defines it?

Title: Incorrect numbers in Reputation Leagues
Body: In the current monthly Reputation Leagues, one user has more monthly reputation than total. Could this be a counting error or is this an issue because an inconsistency in caching or the methods of calculating reputation?

Title: Question deletion doesn't notify users composing an answer
Body:
I was just writing an answer to a quickly-deleted question.

When you are writing an answer to a question that gets closed, your Post Your Answer gets disabled. When you are writing an answer to a question that gets deleted, there is no notification. Only the question gets grayed out and a banner is shown on top of that, but often you don't see that when typing an answer. When you hit Post Your Answer when you are finally done, you get an error message...

I would suggest to also disable the button when a question gets deleted and possibly show a banner to the user so they don't write the full answer before seeing it was useless to write any further.

Title: Open links in browser via long tap menu
Body:
Some links from posts can be opened in app, another links can be opened in browser only. But sometimes I want to open 1st type link in browser too. E.g. tag link:

Is it possible to add to this menu ability to open link in browser?

Currently "Open" item works as if short tap was performed.

Title: Can I view which communities I am not a member of?
Body:
I want to try finding new Stack Exchange communities that I haven't participated in before.

My network profile includes my complete list of communities, but I can't find a way of seeing which communities I haven't joined yet.

How can I see which SE communities I have not participated in?

Title: How do I hide a community from my network profile?
Body:
I want to hide an account from my network profile.

I would like to reference my Stack Exchange profile in a professional setting. I do not want one of my accounts publically displayed for employers to see.

I've heard that it's possible to add accounts to a list of hidden communities, but I haven't been able to find any way to add them from my network profile page.

How can I hide a community from my Network Profile?

Title: Allow mobile users to review posts
Body:
I have recently discovered reviewing posts and am working towards the respective badges. However, the majority of the time (even now) I use the mobile app, rather than the desktop. Therefore I was very disappointed when I couldn't find a way of reviewing posts while on the app.

Feature request: add in a way for people to review posts while on the app, for both iOS and Android.

Personally, I think that having a button to access this would be best placed here in the iOS app, but that's just my opinion.

What do you think? Is this a plausible idea?

Title: New "no longer needed" flag reason title is incorrect
Body:
The comment flags have been improved to look like this (stealing the image from Shog9's answer describing them):

It's a small thing, but "no longer needed" is incorrect; "longer" doesn't belong there. Shog9's post says the reason should be used for non-abusive unconstructive comments. An unconstructive comment was never needed. (Nor, arguably, an over-chatty comment, etc.)

This isn't just terminology; when presented with the new reasons the first time, it really brought me up short that my only apparent options were (effectively) "abusive", "obsolete", or "moderator." Yes, further reading of the (handy) descriptions helps, but "longer" serves no purpose and does hamper comprehension.

So simply "not needed" is all we need (though I'd prefer "not useful").

Title: Tag wildcards `*` break URL parsing in chat
Body:
URLs containing tag wildcard characters * do not work properly in chat.

This means that a chat message containing the URL https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/java* will redirect to https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/java when clicked.

As a workaround, it is possible to manually hyperlink URLs with asterisk characters using markdown formatting. (i.e. [java*](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/java*) = java*)

You can see this for yourself in the Stack Overflow Chat Sandbox.

Title: I can't add comments to my own question that was asked as guest
Body:
I've asked this question as a guest Burn smell from arduino uno

Now, I think I had account on stackoverflow with the SAME EMAIL ADDRESS When I tried to login with that email I just get this new account I'm writing from now and can't add comments to my question. So, What can I do ?

Title: What is the role of meta threads?
Body:
This question is precipitated by my question on CS.SE here. I cross-posted it on the mathematics exchange, and it was put on hold by D.W. for this reason, with him/her citing this meta thread. My question is, is it stack exchange policy that questions violating peer consensus as laid out on any meta thread, but not violating any rule enshrined in the help center are to be put on hold and/or closed as "off topic?"

If this is the case, am I the only one who thinks this is an idiotic way to do things? It seems to me that if questions are closed as off topic they should (1). actually be off topic and (2). the linked to portion of the help center should be able to tell you why your question is not satisfactory. If questions can be closed for "violating peer consensus on meta" then there should be a "violating peer consensus on meta" banner with a link to meta. "off topic" should not be a term for "we don't like it for reasons specified in the comments even if it is actually on topic."

Title: Can we have a search option for questions with bounties? (No, I don't mean hasnotice:1)
Body:
Over the years, there have been multiple requests asking how to search for questions and answers with bounties.

  • How can I search for bounty questions? (Jun 21 '10)
  • How can I find questions that I have asked that currently have bounties on them? (Aug 26 '10)
  • Advanced search criteria for bounty questions? (Oct 21 '10)
  • Advanced search option to include questions with bounty among the search criteria and other cool search options (Nov 28 '10)
  • Query bounties set by specific user (Feb 7 '11)
  • How to show Unanswered question filtered by bounty request? (Mar 17 '11)
  • Is there a way to search for expired bounties? (Sep 11 '11)
  • List previously featured questions (Oct 7 '11)
  • Is there a way to search for past bounties and their amounts? (Feb 20 '12)
  • Search for answers that have been awarded bounties (Mar 31 '12)
  • Can we get some better bounty hunting tools? (Apr 24 '12)
  • How to search only unanswered questions with an open bounty ? (Aug 26 '12)
  • Is there a way to search questions with bounties (ever having had a bounty)? (Nov 30 '12)
  • Is there a special option to search featured only? (Dec 11 '12)
  • Finding featured questions without answer (Jan 26 '13)
  • Why :hasbounty search option was never implemented? (Feb 27 '13)
  • Searching for open questions with large open bounties (Aug 26 '13)
  • Finding Featured Unanswered Posts (Sep 26 '13)
  • Syntax to search for bounty questions (Feb 10 '14)
  • add an hasBounty:bool in search tool (Feb 26 '14)
  • Find bounty questions for specific tags (Sep 12 '14)
  • Show only questions with a bounty and without an accepted answer? (Feb 26 '15)
  • How to find past questions within a particular tag that offered a bounty? (Jul 31 '15)
  • How to search for all questions with bounties across the network? (Nov 6 '15)
  • How can I find a list of questions that used to have a bounty, i.e. the bounty has been awarded? (Nov 15 '15)
  • How to see featured (bounty) questions from all Stack Exchange sites? (Apr 21 '16)

Currently, there isn't a search option to search questions with bounties. (The closest alternative is hasnotice:1, but it includes posts with any type of notice.)

Can a search option hasbounty: be added to find questions with bounties?

Title: Checkbox state not retained bug is back on Post a Question
Body:
This bug is back in a new incarnation (same bug, different checkbox): I recently posted a question along with a self-answer. I wanted to post the answer as a CW, so I ticked the Community wiki box. Then I clicked Post your Question and Answer and it warned me I was trying to create a new tag (I'd added a hyphen to a tag that it doesn't have). I fixed that and posted, and noticed that the answer wasn't a CW.

I tested that here on MSE and noted that if your post doesn't go through because of a warning or error, the Community wiki checkbox becomes unchecked again. It should retain its status.

Looks like when the self-answer stuff was added, the old logic handling the old (no longer present) checkboxes wasn't done.

Title: Which of my answers have been upvoted on the most days?
Body:
My theory is that answers which have received upvotes on 15 distinct days spaced across a year were in fact more valuable than answers which received 100 upvotes within a 2 day period (after reaching the HNQ list) and were upvoted on only two later days after the initial surge.

Similar to the "HNQ boost," when an old question gets an edit or a new answer, the post is bumped to the home page of whatever site it's on and may draw additional attention (and votes). This is perfectly fine, but it's different from receiving an upvote from someone who searched (say, on Google) for that exact question (because they were facing that problem), found the post, and marked it as helpful.

I played around with data.stackexchange.com but couldn't work out how to find the dates of upvotes/downvotes. I know this data must be stored, because it's visible in the "reputation" tab on any user account.

How can I query for the posts which have been upvoted on the most days?

To put in pseudocode what I'm trying to do, it would be something like this:

select count(distinct votedate), postid from posts natural join votes
where postuserid = 'mine' and votetype = 'upvote'
group by postid order by count desc

(Which would probably need typecasting or substring function call to make a date out of a timestamp, but that gives the essence of what I want.)

Title: What about the "share-alike" when citing SE in publications?
Body:
A lot has been discussed about citations in general, especially attribution. My concern is more with the "share-alike". It is answered here that SE considers the "share-alike" doesn't apply to code.

I see more and more papers citing Stack Exchange communities or using SE data, in all sorts of domains.

What about the "share-alike" part of the licence when citing other SE user content in academic publications? Discussion in general, whether it be paraphrased or directly quoted. (e.g. let's say someone is investigating sense of humor in SE communities)

Considering that academic publications are not open for the most part. Does this restrict to publishing in open journals? Do researchers ask for a different licence? And what of mainstream media that are behind a paygate?

Title: Is the behaviour of code snippets correct, when doing a review task?
Body:
I was reviewing a post, and it looked to me that it had an obvious error in its code-- but it had a Code Snippet button, so I decided to click it to make sure this obvious error was there. Sure enough, it was.

However, when I clicked the Return to the Post button, it returned to a (different) post for me to review. I am having trouble finding other review posts with code snippets, to see if this happens every time. Is there a way for me to check this?

I am using Safari 10.1.

Title: Make "you are commenting on" text more visible
Body:
When you are commenting on post in the iOS-app you can see red text below that post. If post already contains several answers it is hard to find post where you commenting on without reading the text:

My request is to highlight text on active post with different color to quickly distinguish post where you commenting on.

Title: How do I find chat rooms I've participated in previously?
Body:
I've moved a few comment chains to chat, and assuming I would be notified of replies, closed the chat windows (btw if anyone could point me to some information about how chat notifications work, that'd be great). I just remembered about those chat rooms and would like to check them for replies, but I can't find a list of rooms I've participated in previously.

So how would I find the chat rooms I've been active in previously?

Title: Nomination suspension notification modal window z-index issue
Body:
I was suspended within the last year and when I tried opening the nomination window, I get this z-index messed up view.

The fix is simple. Currently the z-index of the .lightbox is 8950. And our notification modal (.message.message-takeover) has it as 1001 !important, both in all.css. Either we need to override the !important with the right value of greater than 8950 or we need to get rid of the !important.

.message.message-takeover {
  position: absolute;
  width: 480px;
  top: 260px;
  left: calc(50% - 240px);
  z-index: 1001 !important;               /* Change this to 8951? */
}

A possible solution would be:

.message.message-takeover {
  position: absolute;
  width: 480px;
  top: 260px;
  left: calc(50% - 240px);
  z-index: 8955 !important;               /* Change this to 8955 */
}

Title: Can we have a "read more" thing?
Body:
Some questions get too many long answers, and it makes scrolling to the bottom of the page very difficult.

For example, consider this question on ELU Meta, which is an effort to preserve all relevant content from the now-deprecated ELU Blog.

We have added links to each answer within the question body for quick access, but this is not applicable to the usual questions asked on main sites.

Can we have those looong answers default to a "snippet" state and expand only on clicking "read more"?

This is not necessary for all posts, but for only those posts having a lot of long answers. Look at Quora, for example. They make everything a snippet. I'm not asking for that extreme a thing, though.

Title: How does searching by relevance work when searching a single tag?
Body:
While browsing the tags on my user profile, I decided to click one of the tags to see what post I had made with that specific tag.

Clicking support ran a search for user:351462 [support] sorted by relevance.

Normally I'd assume that searching by relevance would be based on the frequency of specific keywords. However, I'm not sure how a search for "Relevance" works when searching for definitive properties like these. Wouldn't any post I've written with the support tag be 100% relevant?

How does sorting by relevance work when every matching post should theoretically be 100% relevant?

Title: Reopening a question does not clear the custom duplicate list created by gold hammer
Body:
I noticed a question that was closed as duplicate, but the dupe targets were wrong. Gold hammer edited the list to add another target in addition to the original, but still both were wrong.

I did find a correct dupe target, so I reopened the question (using my own hammer) and closed as duplicate of the other question I found. To my surprise, the wrong duplicates appeared again!

I had to manually edit the list of duplicates, and now it's fine. Still, reopening should clear this list.

The bug can be seen in the revisions list:

Title: Edit a tag info if original author is not active anymore
Body:
I wrote a pretty detailed tag wiki (over 800 words) for Kotlin but it seems like the original author of this tag wiki is not active anymore as he was last seen in April.

Is there any way my edit can still be approved for example by an administrator or something like that?

Title: Why hasn't my profile picture updated on SE.com?
Body:
I changed my profile picture across SE on May 23rd. My profile picture on stackexchange.com still hasn't updated, though.

I've used Update profile info several times, and it still hasn't changed. I see the old picture (Sauron):

Why isn't this changing?

Title: Unnecessary backslash characters added when hyperlinking code block with brackets `[]`
Body:
While writing a post, if the hyperlink tool is used on a code block containing [ or ], the tool will add extraneous backslash \ characters in front of the brackets.

Example: user:351462 [support] -> user:351462 \[support\].

Title: Don't join chat rooms automatically when following a link
Body:
Currently, when you follow a link to a chat room, you'll automatically join the room. This means, everyone in the room sees who's just entering that room.

For me personally, this is almost never the desired behaviour. I want to read the contents of the room, joining a room is an entirely separate decision for me. I almost never join a room unless I intend to participate in the discussion.

This behaviour is for one surprising, I don't think everyone expects that they'll be publicly joining a particular chat room just by following a link. This is made even worse by the "convert comments to chat" function, which leaves chat links scattered on the main sites. I can't just read the converted comments, I have to join the chat because it's the only link there (unless I manually try to find the room). For me this means that I never actually follow the links to chat unless it's something really important to me.

Joining a chat room is an active action to me, not something that should automatically happen without the user's consent. It has privacy implications, other users get notified that you're looking at that chat room at that specific point in time. It can also provoke reactions, suddenly I'm greeted by someone I don't know because they noticed I entered that room. As I'm a moderator they might also suspect that there is some kind of trouble which caused me to enter that room.

Following a link to a chat room should not automatically make you join that room. The easiest way would be to just redirect to the transcript, but that could be confusing for people that aren't familiar with SE chat. The other option would be to still go to the live chat page, but without joining chat. So the bar at the bottom would have a big "join this chat room" button instead of the message box.

Title: What is child meta in StackExchange?
Body:
I saw word called child meta in https://meta.stackexchange.com/a/81701/362477.

Then I searched about it. I saw a few questions which related child meta.

But I could not find what is child meta?

Title: What's the difference between [retag-request] and [synonym-request]?
Body:
I'm a bit unclear what the difference is between a retag-request and a synonym-request.

retag-request

This tag is for requests to replace one tag with another existing tag. It also applies to requests that one tag should be merged into another, or simply abandoned.

synonym-request

A request to add one tag as the synonym of another tag. Please be specific about which tag should be a synonym of which. Bidirectional synonyms and cycles are implicitly disallowed, so suggest wisely.

A few years back there was a request to Synonymize [retag-request] and [synonym-request], which didn't seem to have ever gone through. The top answer stated the following:

...even though the mechanisms are different I think the [subtle differences] are usually lost on the people making the request.

It's worth noting that

  • 24 of the top 50 synonym-request questions are also tagged with retag-request.
  • 12 of the top 50 retag-request questions are also tagged with synonym-request.
  • 142 questions are tagged as both synonym-request and retag-request

What is the difference between a retag request and a synonym request?

Title: Please show suggested edits in the network profile activity page
Body:
Often, I suggest an edit to a HNQ question (maybe creating an account just for that). However, I probably wouldn't normally visit the site of that HNQ again, but I would like to know what happens to my suggested edit. That's easy if it got approved, but the more interesting case is if it was rejected. Rejected edits are opportunities for learning, and not being able to track them means I might lose such opportunities.

In the current system, it's difficult to keep track of edits I suggested to various HNQs. The network profile's activity tab only shows approved edits, and even those are lost in the volume of edits I make elsewhere where I have edit privileges.

Please add a "suggestions" subtab like in the per-site profile's all activity tab.

Title: Hot Questions suggestions showing question I am currently viewing
Body:
Okay so I was viewing this question when I noticed that the suggested hot network questions is still suggesting this page.. but I am currently viewing it already.

I mean no offense to anyone, I have the utmost respect for the Stack exchange dev team and it isn't really a big deal and it harms no one I guess.. but maybe redesign hot network questions to show a different question instead?

It's just a little teeny tiny suggestion though.. and if it's like that by design then it's cool. Still love the site. Just trying to be helpful in the smallest way I guess

Title: Why is there no popular/notable/famous answer badge?
Body:
I see that in all Stack Exchange sites (at least the ones I checked) there are badges for Popular, Notable, and Famous Question, when it gets to 1k, 2.5k, and 10k views, respectively.

My question is why are there no similar badges for Answers also? Is it because the question is the one that caused the answers to also be seen?

I suspect that to be able to give those badges we should be able to quantify the views of an answer. Is it ok to assume that if some Question has x views then all answers from that question also have x views? Or only those highly upvoted or accepted?

Another option could be to count the views that Question gained since the posting of that answer, and assign that to be the number of views of a specific answer (this will also prevent new answers on famous posts to instantly get the badge). However I do not know how complex this type of queries could be.

Title: Allow YouTube /embed URLs to be embedded
Body:
Certain SE sites allow YouTube videos to be embedded by pasting in the URL. Testing on the Formatting Sandbox shows that SE supports a few different URL types.

Ironically, one URL type that can't be embedded on Stack Exchange are /embed URLs.

The advantage of an /embed YouTube URL is that it allows for extra parameters, such as setting a specific end time. (i.e. https://www.youtube.com/embed/BSpAWkQLlgM?start=89&end=108)

Would it be possible to support embedding for /embed YouTube URLs?

Title: Console on snippet going behind contents
Body:
I was googling for a code and I reached this Stack Overflow page.

Owl Carousel on change not working

I tried running the code in answer and it will log something in console in every slide change.

But after few slide changes, the console's height is crossed the content. Normally the console should be shown front side and the page should be scrollable and the content should be pushed to backward but it is not happening.

I then tried on MSE and the issue is here.

There are many sites that make use of Snippet not only Stack Overflow.

Here is a sample code to reproduce the issue. Try changing the slide for 4-5 times.

var owl;
$(document).ready(function(){
  owl = $(".owl-carousel").owlCarousel({
    autoplay: true,
    autoplaySpeed: 300,
    loop: true,
    navSpeed: 300,
    items: 1,
    margin: 2
  });
  owl.on('changed.owl.carousel', function(e) {
    console.log("test");
  });
});
body {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
}

.owl-carousel .item {
  height: 120px;
  background: #4DC7A0;
  padding: 1rem;
  list-style: none;
  margin: 10px;
  text-align: center;
  color: white;
  font-size: 20px;
  line-height: 120px;
}
<script src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/2.1.1/jquery.min.js"></script>
<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/OwlCarousel2/2.1.6/assets/owl.carousel.css">
<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/OwlCarousel2/2.1.6/assets/owl.theme.default.min.css">
<script type="text/javascript" src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/OwlCarousel2/2.1.6/owl.carousel.min.js"></script>
<!-- Set up your HTML -->

<div class="owl-carousel">
  <div class="item"> slide1 </div>
  <div class="item"> slide2 </div>
  <div class="item"> slide3 </div>
  <div class="item"> slide4 </div>
  <div class="item"> slide5 </div>
  <div class="item"> slide6 </div>
  <div class="item"> slide7 </div>
  <div class="item"> slide8 </div>
  <div class="item"> slide9 </div>
</div>

credit for code : Dekel

Title: What to do if user always uses comments for correct answers?
Body:
On multiple occasions, I have realized that good and correct answers are provided directly via comments. Thus, leaving the question unanswered or/and loosing out on good answers, as the user tends to delete the comments later on.

For example this, where even other Stack Overflow users agree. Is there a solution to this?

I don't have anything against any specific user. I just wish all good answers are kept for future references, not deleted via comments.

Title: Network Profile showing wrong answer count
Body:
I was just looking at my Network Profile accounts page, and noticed that it says I have zero answers on Meta Stack Exchange:

If you look at the answer tab in my profile activity, however, you will see that I do have 1 answer:

I posted this answer almost 2 years ago, so this does not look like a delay or sync issue.

My Meta Stack Exchange account has always been part of my main account, so this is not a case of the number being off because of merged accounts, like I had here.

Why is the Network Profile count not showing the correct answer count?

Title: Edit button doesn't show error in the review queue
Body:
I was reviewing first posts and noticed that I could not edit one of the posts (I had too many pending edits), normally there is an error message to explain this, however there isn't in the review queue (this is reproducible by me?):

I realise this is similar to Why is the edit button disabled? and Show when edits are pending to avoid "why can't I edit this" however I do know why it is disabled (I checked by trying to edit on a normal question) and the feature has status-completed (and is working outside of the review queues)

Is this a bug or intentional behaviour?

Title: When is my chat room most active -- in general, not just this week?
Body:
The info page for a chat room shows activity over the past day (by hour) and the past week (by chunk of day), like this:

Is there a way to see data for a longer period of time, like the last month or the last quarter (or even the last year)? I'd like to understand when a room is generally busy or quiet, not just when it was on a particular week.

I'm not asking about activity on the main site, which I can measure using SEDE. SEDE doesn't have chat data.

Title: Improving your own suggested edit makes you leave the First Posts review queue
Body:
When reviewing the First Posts (and Late Answers) review queue, after you suggest an edit, you're back in the review queue and the I'm Done button is activated. So far, so good, but when I realize I want to edit something else as well (I often forget the tags), I can click the 'edit' link again. When I'm done improving my suggested edit, I'm suddenly outside the review queue.

This does not happen if you have enough reputation (2k) to edit posts straight away; then you always stay in the review queue.

Title: Copy Editor badge is not included to my account even after I have edited 500 posts
Body: I have a problem regarding the Copy Editor badge. I have edited more than 500 posts in total. Still, I cannot receive Copy Editor badge in my account. And also, Copy Editor badge track (progress bar) also disappears from next badge track window.

Title: Is it ok to explain the justification for a question in the question itself (or comment)?
Body:
If a poster has a question that is clearly on-topic according to the help, but is drawing comments that it is "off topic", should the justification for the question (such as citing the relevant line in the help) be put in the question itself to make it more visible, or just bury it in the comments?

The reason for asking this is that some readers may not read through all the comments and see the justification and thereby just repeat the mistake of earlier readers.

Title: How can I separate multiple quote blocks?
Body:
I have a series of quotes which I want to display in two separate quote blocks.

> Are questions about Microsoft Word Online on-topic here? I don't
> really see any posted here, but perhaps I am not searching correctly.
> - mweiss
> 
> Yes, they are. We even have a specific tag: [tag:word-online]. -ale
> 
> Thanks! I'm sorry I missed that tag. -mweiss

When I try to add these to my post, they display as a single combined quote.

Are questions about Microsoft Word Online on-topic here? I don't really see any posted here, but perhaps I am not searching correctly. - mweiss

Yes, they are. We even have a specific tag: word-online. -ale

Thanks! I'm sorry I missed that tag. -mweiss

How can I separate quotes so that they aren't combined into a single quote block?

Title: Which site should I use for demographics questions?
Body: Specifically, I want to ask about the difference between income per capita and GDP per capita, because I've looked at those statistics for the same area and they don't seem to be the same. Also, I want to know if there is a database for GDP of US counties and where to find it. So which SE site should I use to ask these types of questions?

Title: Changing an email settings toggle scrolls the page horizontally to the left
Body: I was changing my email settings with the new Email Settings feature in a narrow browser window. I scrolled to the right to see the settings toggles. Whenever I change one of the toggles, the page scrolls to the left and I have to scroll to see the toggles again.

Title: Which sites have graduated?
Body:
When a beta site is shown to have a strong, healthy community, it can be selected for site graduation.

Most graduated sites can be identified by their unique design and site logo. However, this is not always the case.

  • Which sites have been chosen for graduation?
  • Which sites have graduated without a unique design?

Title: Leading "For" in site descriptions reads badly in non-English languages
Body:
So far the description for all sites is in the same format

For [some people]

However the leading word "For" is always in English, so it reads, um... a bit strange when followed by words in other languages

For programadores profissionais e entusiastas
For programadores y profesionales de la informática
For программистов
For лингвистов, этимологов, и энтузиастов русского языка
For プログラマーとプログラミングに熱心の人

Reading that feels like reading a frase γραπτός на misturado sprachen.

Reading that feels like reading a sentence written in mixed languages.
(Word order: Spanish, Greek, Russian, Portuguese, German)

Can we simply remove the leading "For" and re-write the site description for non-English sites (maybe there's no need to rewrite them)?

Title: Do you get penalized if you ask too many questions?
Body:
I've been having to ask a LOT of questions on SO lately - I'm a lone developer at my company working on a lot of different tech stacks and I don't really have anyone reliable in house to ask for help. My specific question is do I lose points if I max out my allotted daily/monthly quota?

I make sure to research my questions thoroughly, and include links to previous answers and resources that didn't help me. I work hard to make sure I provide a MCVE for every question I ask.

Title: Search for existing questions asked by someone else
Body: Please add the search feature for the existing questions asked by someone else, which the current user is going to ask. How to see the answers to my questions if the same is asked and answered previously by someone else?

Title: How to include hyperlinks in SEDE CSV dumps?
Body:
Glorfindel pointed me to two very helpful SEDE queries; and I thought: OK, let's save as CSV and import into a spread sheet and work that later on.

But to my surprise, the CSV dump only contains two columns:

Post Link,CreationDate "28928266","2015-03-08 15:42:03"

So - is there a way to not only get links in the SEDE query result view - but in the CSV file it creates for me?

Title: Allow open in browser for answers in the Android app
Body:
Currenty only a question can be opened in browser via "more..." button.

It would be good if such action could be possible for answers too.

Title: Do images really have to fill the entire page width?
Body:
On this question on tex.SE (and on many, many other posts on several sites) I once again noticed that pictures uploaded are always made full page width.

This is often way too much for the image. For example in the linked question, I uploaded a math-formatted equation. That would fill the whole width and become enormous. So I have to append white-space on either side of it and upload it like that.

Is there no way to set image sizes? At least to set the sizes to the original image sizes - I would understand issues with users setting their own dimensions, but at the very least the picture should not be shown in larger dimensions that what it is uploaded in.

Title: What happens to a serial downvoter reputation?

I have seen what happens to a serial downvoter, but I have some "follow on" questions:

  • Is any of this "visible" on the "activity/reputation" page of another user? Meaning: would those -3 and +3 show up there?

Title: Tag search doesn't work properly
Body:
I am trying to do a search on SO where I include a few tags, and exclude a few:

[c#] or [java] or [winforms] -[android] -[android-studio]

Link to search

The problem is, questions with the tags c#, java, and/or winforms are included, but questions with the tags android and/or android-studio are NOT excluded.

Based on what I read in this answer, I should have my excludes before my includes:

-[android] -[android-studio] [c#] or [java] or [winforms]

However, when I try and execute that search, it automatically reorders it with the includes before the excludes.

Is there something I am doing wrong, or is this a bug/feature?

Title: List of questions sorted based on their spoiler markdown percentage
Body:
On some entertainment sites (e.g. Anime.SE where I'm actively participating on), sometimes spoiler markdown is used to... hide spoilers.

While its usage is usually considerate, sometimes it's overused until there's nothing left shown normally on the post like this question.

(however, this meta post is not asking about the policy of overusing spoiler markdown)

Is there a tool/SEDE query to get a list of questions based on their spoiler markdown percentage? For example, the linked question probably consists of around 90% spoiler block.

This might help to find questions that could probably be improved by reducing spoiler blocks to a considerate amount.

Title: Where to ask about the legal / illegal behavior of software
Body:
In case there already is a Q/A, the question is:

What is the legal stance on software automatically copying referral links to the clipboard without user permission or prompting?

This has to do with a game, so I see this falling into legal, software dev and game dev categories. I've tried asking programming / legal questions before with much difficulty as to where to ask... any advice on how / where to ask this?

Title: Footer extending in the stackexchange.com in mobile web view
Body:
The newly introduced footer is extending in the https://stackexchange.com site in mobile web view.

Screenshot for reference:

Title: Allow cross-site tag linking
Body:
I would like an option on Meta communities to reference tags from different sites, similar to the distinction between [tag:] and [meta-tag:].

To keep things standardized, cross-site tags could use the same naming-format as data.SE styled "magic links".

  • [so-tag:java] → java
  • [su-tag:microsoft-excel] → microsoft-excel
  • [gaming-tag:gaming-history] → gaming-history

Questions where cross-site tags would be helpful

  • What symbols/characters are not allowed in tags?
  • Is there an SE site where I can ask about the history of video games?
  • Where should I ask a question about NFS Most Wanted (2005)?

Title: Advice on Old Art
Body: I have a picture of an old print of a painting I found in my attic. Is there a site where I might ask if anyone can help me identify when it was made or who the artist might be? Or at least give ideas on how to determine these things? I considered photography, but couldn't for sure tell if that would be on-topic.

Title: How can I view my most recent questions across SE?
Body:
I want to review my most recent questions and answers across the Stack Exchange network.

I can view my newest questions for a specific site by appending ?tab=questions&sort=newest to my user profile, but this isn't an option on my Network Profile.

I'm not able to use the Stack Exchange Data Explorer for this, as the database is updated weekly.

Is there any way to view my most recent questions across Stack Exchange?

Title: Is it ok to announce I'm planning on placing a bounty?
Body:
I have a question on SO I'd like solved as soon as possible (me and everyone else). The moment a bounty is possible, I plan on setting one. However, I don't mind committing to a bounty right now, and if someone helps me before then, I'll set the bounty and hand it right on over.

Is it ok to finish my question with something like:

I will reward a bounty of +100 to any user who helps solve my problem as soon as one become available.

Or does this go against the nature of the "wait 2 days before setting a bounty" mechanic?

Title: Where can I ask questions when I don't know which SE is the right one?
Body:
On which SE should I ask a questions if I don't know which is the right place for it.

For example, I asked a question on Stackoverflow about websites with programming challenges (recommendation), because I couldn't find a website recommendation SE (like software recommendation) and thought it would fit into SO, but it didn't.

Second questions to this topic: Why are some normal questions put on hold because of off-topic when they are completely normal. First, as a new user, I was very insecure if my questions is right in that SE.

Title: Quickly find and improve usage guidance excerpts on tags
Body:
On META, as well as other Stack sites, there appear to be a large number of tags that have no usage guidance excerpt. (The tag wiki is often left blank, too, but the excerpt is of more importance.)

Currently, tags on most Stack sites can be sorted by the following criteria:

  • popular
  • name
  • new

In addition, when browsing the list of tags, tags and tag synonyms are presented together with no obvious way to differentiate between the two (after a little time editing, you can learn to spot the difference between most of them).

Many of us enjoy organizing, improving, and curating.

Is there any way to sort, or to browse a list of incomplete tag excerpts?

Title: How do I report a user for having a potentially malicious URL on their profile?
Body:
Say for example that someone's profile has a link that exhibits malicious behaviour such as redirecting users to other possibly malicious websites. Also assume that this url is crafted in such a way that it does not appear to be malicious (i.e. it is crafted in such a way that the url resembles what it claims to be linking to).

How would I go about reporting this?

Title: Does data explorer give access to the markdown version of post? (photobucket issue)
Body:
Photobucket has gone bad, so I've a number of old posts across the network which have broken images as I made them prior to the imgur deal.

The internal search doesn't work - "user:me photobucket" has 0 results - so the best I've been able to do so far is a google search "site:meta.stackexchange.com adam davis photobucket" which does produce some results, but I'm not sure it catches all of them.

I want to fix them, but I don't have the time right now, and when I do have time I don't want to re-educate myself on the data explorer, so:

Is there a simple search I can perform on the data explorer, or is there a better way, to figure out which of my posts still need correction?

I recognize that due to licensing issues Stack Exchange probably can't just slurp the images over from one service to the other or automate it for us, and I suspect that it's not a big issue since it was so long ago, and people are fixing relevant posts as they run into them, so putting much effort into automating it probably isn't warranted, but a method to discover my own would be nice.

yes this is a plzsndmetehcodez question, downvote accordingly...

Title: Searching unanswered questions with certain tags not working?
Body:
If I do a search like this: answers:0 [java] -[android] by typing it into the search box, I get expected results, like below:

However, if I first do a search using the tags [java] -[android], and then click the Unanswered tab as below:

then I get no search results at all:

This is the URL: https://stackoverflow.com/unanswered/tagged/java+-android

Am I missing something here?

Title: Display maximum possible count of sites in footer
Body:
New collapsing/expanding footer displays sites by catecories. E.g. Technology section is most solid and contains more then five columns each of them contains seven sites:

Other sections like Science have less items, only two non-full columns and more(10) link:

Seems there is possible to display all of science sites, so more link will not be actually needed.

Why the list of sites here is intentionally reduced? Is it possible to show all of them in this case?

Title: What is the proper way to reference a user in comments?
Body:
If I am commenting and want to reference another user, sometimes when I use @[username], I get a clickable pop-up with their username, other times I do not.

Some Meta questions indicate that @ isn't needed anymore.

Is there old / new / draft guidance on the "correct" way to reference a user in comments?

Title: Where can I ask about the Tile Bluetooth tracker?
Body:
Is there a site where I can ask questions about the Tile? It is a Bluetooth tracking device which can be configured using a smartphone app.

Example question: I recently purchased a new Tile. I want to ask whether it is possible transfer my old name, photo, and ringtone over to the new device.

I could imagine it possibly being on-topic for Super User, Internet of Things, or Ask Different.

Title: Allow ordering "deleted comments by" page by deletion date
Body:
When reviewing automatic "possible vandalism: comment deletions" flags, I usually go to mod > info > comments > deleted to review what's been going on.

Currently, the list is ordered only by comment creation date, and can't be ordered by deletion date. Folks are often purging old comments (like 'possible duplicate of' and other such obsolete comments), but there isn't a single place to review these.

It'd be advantageous to order that list by comment deletion date when reviewing these flags. Can we get a tab for that?

Title: What's the equivalent to "Awaiting response" from bugtrackers on SE?
Body:
When users of a bugtracker get asked a question like "Does this still happen?" (on old reports), "What do you mean by [...]?" or similar important questions and they don't answer in weeks or months, the report gets marked as "Awaiting response" (like here).

Here I've seen cases where such a marking would also be useful, but it's not obvious to me what to choose. For example here the question for the error message was not answered and without an answer the problem can't be solved (because nobody else can reproduce it). Here I asked questions and got no response, someone else wrote an answer with guesses, but that answer was neither voted nor accepted, nor commented on.

Should questions like these be...

  • ...flagged as "unclear what you're asking"? I did that so far, because it seemed like the closest in the usual flag reasons, but that was apparently wrong and I was banned from flagging for a week.
  • ...flagged as "in need of moderation intervention"? There I can leave comments to specify what I need.
  • ...just left alone in case the user answers a long time later?

Title: Unexplained Undownvote after 4 days on an unedited post
Body:
A few days ago someone serial-downvoted my questions:

It didn't bother me too much, and I let the serial voting script to reverse the downvotes, and it did - Except of one question:

One downvote is not the end of the world, so I just moved on. But today however, I noticed something strange on my reputation summary - An undownvote event on that remaining downvoted question:

I posted that question on Dec 2013 and it has never been edited. I wonder how could this scenario be possible, to undownvote after 4 days since the vote was originally cast. Or maybe it was the leftovers of the voting script that was reversed 3 days later?

I searched for similar questions and come across Serial downvote reversals don't always appear as such but the accepted answer confimed it was a bug that was fixed, so I'm confused by that delayed undownvote.

Title: Weird address parameter when switching between full and mobile versions
Body:
Whenever I switch between full and mobile versions of the site (via links in the footer) I see weird unique parameter in browser's address line:

What's this?

Title: Wasn't there a "not constructive" flag for comments?
Body:
I thought there was such a thing - and yes, I see that a handful of my comment flags are about "not constructive".

I wanted to use it just now - but the list of available flags only shows "rude", "obsolete", "moderator attention".

I assume that such changes are announced somewhere - so bonus question: where can one find a comprehensive list of such kind of "UI updates"?

Title: Full stop at end of tag name - recognised by the system in some places and not others
Body:
A tag with a full stop at the end of its name, like example-tag., is recognised as the same tag as example-tag in some parts of the system but not in others. For example:

  • putting a full stop into the end of a tag while editing a question seems to be impossible (it just redirects back to the tag without the full stop);
  • an attempt to mod-merge a tag without a full stop into the same tag with a full stop yielded a "can't merge a tag into itself" error;

but:

  • clicking on the tag name with a full stop doesn't redirect to the tag without the full stop.

I came across this while trying to create a tag for The Rise and Fall of D.O.D.O. at the SFF Stack Exchange. The current tag looks like the-rise-and-fall-of-d.o.d.o, and it seems to be impossible to rename this tag to have the full stop at the end, but clicking on the tag name with the full stop gives a list of 0 questions rather than redirecting to the list without the full stop.

Title: Where do I ask a question which is related to both travel and money?
Body:
I have this question:

A conference where I am invited to, as a speaker, asks to select either one of the following 2 options for money transfer:

  1. Direct deposit in USD
  2. Wire transfer.

The conference is happening in London UK. But, if selected the wire transfer, they shall be wiring from the USA.

So, which option would be beneficial for me (Indian citizen), considering the conversion for direct deposit and the wire transfer commission cuts[if any]?

I am confused between Travel SE and Money SE. Where would this question be more appropriate?

Title: Don't impose delay loading Close dialog when you haven't just loaded it
Body:
Because of this bug, clicking the "close" link on a question that's been edited (for me usually the edit comes in a half-second before, as I'm reaching for the link) reloads the question instead of opening the Close dialog. Clicking it again to actually open the close dialog says

You may only open the Close dialog every three seconds

I didn't open it, I refreshed the post.

And yes, there are lots of times when the post edit is so trivial it's obvious in less than a second that it doesn't affect the need to close the question.

Title: How can moderators track badge progress of tags?
Body:
Tag progress bars look like this for regular users of a site:

However, that part of the profile page is empty for moderators. [Maybe cause one can choose between tracking privileges and tracking tag progress, and mods all the available privileges].

I find the tag progress a nice gamification feature. So, wanted to know if tag progress feature would be available to the mods too sometime in the future? If not, then would it be a good idea to have?
